commit_message:
Update api-ref for uuid type and fix tox

The API reference documentation theme now supports the "uuid" type[1].
This patch updates the Octavia API reference to use the uuid type where
appropriate to clarify the type.

This patch also fixes the api-ref tox target for the new documentation
requirements.txt file.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528597/

Change-Id: Ia7dfe2a26140fba0208531bd8e8e82163eb75347

commit_message:
Replace Chinese punctuation with English punctuation

Curly quotes(Chinese punctuation) usually input from Chinese input method.
When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

Change-Id: I40fed2db58b87188c5c405f7d3b43d6ccd51016e

[{'created': '2018-02-02 02:03:12.000000000', 'message': 'Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I1e2446a9ce0d6d1378a627963db1bb71533c21f7
'}]
commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I1e2446a9ce0d6d1378a627963db1bb71533c21f7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-24 19:41:43.000000000', 'message': 'Remove use of construct lib FieldError exception

Version 2.8.22 of the construct lib has introduced a change that
removed the core.FieldError exception. Since the explicit
exception handling when parsing LLDP is not necessary, this has

commit_message:
Remove use of construct lib FieldError exception

Version 2.8.22 of the construct lib has introduced a change that
removed the core.FieldError exception. The check now uses the
parent exception - core.ConstructError.

Change-Id: I31922c2afc2018a4f6f7ba48094388070537a13f
Closes-Bug: 1745208

commit_message:
Neutron: make metadata proxy work

- corrected the path of "socket" volume, which is used for sharing
  metadata proxy unix socket among the agents
- and give neutron user permission to write to the dir
- set the default nova_metadata_ip to full hostname of metadata
  so that it could be accessed properly via ingress
- removed unnecessary configurations from values

Change-Id: I4d20dc670fecebd9799851d659c5f42edb4821ac
Closes-Bug:1745370

commit_message:
Handle missing security groups on listener delete

On listener create or delete we update the VIP security group rules to
reflect the addition or removal of the TCP port on the VIP.
In the unusual event that the security group is missing in neutron, even
listener delete calls would fail.
This patch allows listener deletes to continue if the security group is
missing from the VIP.

Change-Id: Ic0186c34d3215869f1b92bcd4c8e015e0dd54053
Story: 2001381
Task: 5955

commit_message:
WIP: Switch to puppetforge for puppet dependencies

By switching to puppetforge, we have a better change of setting up a
reverse proxy cache in openstack-infra, then using github.com.

Change-Id: I12af4c07f0cedf6a778acae881f6d09b82af0fe6
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add SDK list to octavia user docs

This patch adds a page tracking SDKs that support the Octavia API to the
user documentation section.

It also clarifies that the neutron client cookbooks are deprecated.

Change-Id: I0485a07c76b06e3e6219877f318e76dade5e1334

reporter to storyboad instead of launchpad.

commit_message:
Updates the command mapping to include LB stats

The previous patch that added the "loadbalancer stats show" command did
not update the command mapping page. This patch corrects the command mapping
table to include "loadbalancer stats show".

Change-Id: I20dbb9e22dbdc006359b7e899dd95c589880e985

commit_message:
Convert with-X-master tox periodic jobs

Convert the following jobs to Zuul v3 native jobs:
* legacy-periodic-py27-with-oslo-master
* legacy-periodic-py35-with-oslo-master
* legacy-periodic-py35-with-neutron-lib-master
* legacy-periodic-py35-with-ovsdbapp-master

Thanks to tox_install_siblings, this really simplifies the job.

This was tested with:
* https://review.openstack.org/540587
* https://review.openstack.org/540588

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/540592
Change-Id: Ie427b7f5fb217783c024bccce85bcdb2b823e54a

messages: [{'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-01-25 00:28:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-01-25 00:37:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nLooks Ok to me'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-25 03:43:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-02-03 20:47:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-25 00:28:28.000000000', 'message': 'ignore_errors for post-ssh.yaml

Currently we are not using any static nodes in nodepool / zuul, so
deleting our current SSH keys on the remote node should be best
effort.  This should help successful jobs from no longer failing when
we cannot delete SSH keys.

Change-Id: I3dc94182e55e0be6ea118008d492d0da8e462a65
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
ignore_errors for post-ssh.yaml

Currently we are not using any static nodes in nodepool / zuul, so
deleting our current SSH keys on the remote node should be best
effort.  This should help successful jobs from no longer failing when
we cannot delete SSH keys.

Change-Id: I3dc94182e55e0be6ea118008d492d0da8e462a65
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add traits to the ResourceProviders filters

This patch adds support for selecting ResourceProviders based on
required traits. 'Preferred' traits will need to be handled as part of
the weighing process.

Blueprint: resource-provider-tags

Change-Id: I233a23e6fd9166e057bc7d57477977ecd7d3a08a

[{'created': '2018-02-02 21:14:47.000000000', 'message': 'Unable to grow/shrink Vertica 9.x cluster

During the Vertica cluster growing/shrinking,
the "update_vertica" command tries to get AWS
metadata even if --ignore-aws-instance-type is
specified.

The only way to avoid the "_get_macs error" is to
define --ignore-install-config option.

This is very similar to this bug[1] but this time
this for the "trove cluster-grow" and "trove
cluster-shrink" commands.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/trove/+bug/1745493

Change-Id: I35f2035039f72b3aa2d9beb665096d4fb57e1c4c
Closes-Bug: #1747050
'}]
commit_message:
Unable to grow/shrink Vertica 9.x cluster

During the Vertica cluster growing/shrinking,
the "update_vertica" command tries to get AWS
metadata even if --ignore-aws-instance-type is
specified.

The only way to avoid the "_get_macs error" is to
define --ignore-install-config option.

This is very similar to this bug[1] but this time
this for the "trove cluster-grow" and "trove
cluster-shrink" commands.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/trove/+bug/1745493

Change-Id: I35f2035039f72b3aa2d9beb665096d4fb57e1c4c
Closes-Bug: #1747050

DNM: CI check

This is to make sure stuff passes when no glance endpoint is set up in
devstack, when the pile of ksa stuff is in play.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 16:59:35.000000000', 'message': "Replace None with - (hyphen) for value None

In the detail pages, we use 'None' if a corresponding value
is empty, but '-' looks easier to recognize that it is empty
compared to 'None'.

Change-Id: I7613cdd773cd4e70aeb8434efca90cdaf6dc69ea
"}]
commit_message:
Replace None with - (hyphen) for value None

In the detail pages, we use 'None' if a corresponding value
is empty, but '-' looks easier to recognize that it is empty
compared to 'None'.

Change-Id: I7613cdd773cd4e70aeb8434efca90cdaf6dc69ea

subject: Make switched multiple choice field work
messages: [{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-02 16:36:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-03 18:25:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 16:36:15.000000000', 'message': "Make switched multiple choice field work

Due to horizon bug 1732260, ThemableCheckboxSelectMultiple seems
not to work as 'switched' field. The workaround is to replace it
with CheckboxSelectMultiple.

Change-Id: I763291ccbef1660415769fc66a940f7ecd11bbf6
Closes-Bug: #1747011
"}]
commit_message:
Make switched multiple choice field work

Due to horizon bug 1732260, ThemableCheckboxSelectMultiple seems
not to work as 'switched' field. The workaround is to replace it
with CheckboxSelectMultiple.

Change-Id: I763291ccbef1660415769fc66a940f7ecd11bbf6
Closes-Bug: #1747011

commit_message:
Fix issue with missing url parameters

OSC uses these. project_id and tenant_id for neutron are interchangable.
If we list them in the QueryParameters list as project_id='tenant_id'
then a user can specify either. We'd done this for all of the *other*
Resources, but for some reason Network was left out.

ip_version is a valid query parameter for network_ip_availability, and
we even have it documented, but it's not in the list either.

We should have caught this before the last release - but actually only
just now got osc-functional-tips jobs turned back on. Sigh.

Change-Id: I1037dac37b15edbd2b8a17d7ed4ba639cf8e960b

Also update the devstack plugin to know nothing about policy.json, as it
never allowed for customizing the location or the contents anyhow, and
to build ironic.conf from scratch rather than from the sample.

Change-Id: I10a4987204eb335f1fed29d4b1d7f3e075aa1792
'}]
commit_message:
Remove sample policy and config files

Now we have docs, lets point people there rather than attempting to
maintain a copy in tree.

Also update the devstack plugin to know nothing about policy.json, as it
never allowed for customizing the location or the contents anyhow, and
to build ironic.conf from scratch rather than from the sample.

Change-Id: I10a4987204eb335f1fed29d4b1d7f3e075aa1792

subject: Replace use of functools.wraps() with six.wraps()
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages: [{'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2018-02-02 00:33:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-02-02 12:10:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-02-03 14:24:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 00:33:01.000000000', 'message': "Replace use of functools.wraps() with six.wraps()

In Python 2.7, functools.wraps() does not provide the '__wrapped__'
attribute. This attribute is used by
oslo_utils.reflection.get_signature() when getting the signature of a
function. If a function is decorated without the '__wrapped__'
attribute then the signature will be of the decorator rather than the
underlying function.

From the six documentation for six.wraps():
    This is exactly the functools.wraps() decorator, but it sets the
    __wrapped__ attribute on what it decorates as functools.wraps()
    does on Python versions after 3.2.

Change-Id: I11bf2fa945d36bfbc89ec8239e7c9259e3e12496
"}]
commit_message:
Replace use of functools.wraps() with six.wraps()

In Python 2.7, functools.wraps() does not provide the '__wrapped__'
attribute. This attribute is used by
oslo_utils.reflection.get_signature() when getting the signature of a
function. If a function is decorated without the '__wrapped__'
attribute then the signature will be of the decorator rather than the
underlying function.

From the six documentation for six.wraps():
    This is exactly the functools.wraps() decorator, but it sets the
    __wrapped__ attribute on what it decorates as functools.wraps()
    does on Python versions after 3.2.

Change-Id: I11bf2fa945d36bfbc89ec8239e7c9259e3e12496

commit_message:
Ceph: Include release name in cluster roles to prevent collision

This PS includes the release name in the cluster role to prevent
colision if the chart is deployed multiple times in the same
cluster.

Change-Id: I8e90367769a8b955981c0f2cf4f29756c448e1d7

commit_message:
Add tenant_id parameter to be mapped to project_id in network object

That allows to filter networks based on tenant_id parameter and
makes functional test NetworkTests.test_tag_operation from
openstackclient.tests.functional.network.v2.test_network module
pass again.

While checking some stable release changes, it was found there
are a few horizon plugin projects that have not been updated
since the changes with zuulv3. There are a few projects that
either require horizon to be installed, or have not yet
explicitly declared support for the normal publish-to-pypi
release job.

Until they state otherwise, we need to switch these projects
over to the -horizon flavor of this job to be able to pass
validation.

Change-Id: I8bc5bc8101d8375ab20b7e07dd1bfb2f087b20d7
'}]
commit_message:
Switch horizon projects to publish-to-pypi-horizon

While checking some stable release changes, it was found there
are a few horizon plugin projects that have not been updated
since the changes with zuulv3. There are a few projects that
either require horizon to be installed, or have not yet
explicitly declared support for the normal publish-to-pypi
release job.

Until they state otherwise, we need to switch these projects
over to the -horizon flavor of this job to be able to pass
validation.

Change-Id: I8bc5bc8101d8375ab20b7e07dd1bfb2f087b20d7

commit_message:
save tenant_id in ACLMatchCriteria table

Because of null tenant_id, vnffg delete operation fails to delete
entry from ACLMatchCriteria.Hence delete attemp on parent table fails
with DBReferenceError.

Co-Authored-By: Dharmendra Kushwaha<dharmendra.kushwaha@nectechnologies.in>
Closes-Bug: 1658364
Change-Id: I699f66dfa2eab49dc5239e70973b68967f4d0142

commit_message:
Set ufw default policy for routed and outgoing

The charm neglected to set default policy for routed which cases
applications deployed to containers to fail to deploy.

This change explicitly sets default policy allow for routed and
outgoing.

Closes-Bug: #1747032

Change-Id: I440e5e040ad433bf0cf6c4ce99439da456476914

SFC agent extension: Use bulk_pull RPC

Use bulk_pull instead of pull RPC call in agent extension to request chain
hops OVO for a port.

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: VPNInstance and VRF improvements

* use a proper base class for VRF dataplane classes
* improve VPNInstance and VRF unit tests, to
  - avoid multithreading in the text
  - use assert_called_once and assert_not_called
    when possible

Change-Id: Iab4ce99ca5af8ffa278686a5bcd8fe1d5f86239b

Remove insecure registry setting from docker push

insecure registry is removed from docker after 3.0

implemented changes proposed by Mark Goddard

removed whitespace, imported StrictVersion

messages:
[{'account_id': 25660, 'date': '2018-01-22 09:04:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-24 04:52:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Chaolei,

Thanks for working on this feature. I just had a quick look at this patch. I think the approach is correct and it should work very well. I will find another time to take a closer look at the details.'}, {'account_id': 25660, 'date': '2018-01-24 04:57:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for your review. :)'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-25 20:40:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(13 comments)

Chaolei,

Great work! I saw the actions and actions_events were recorded properly for each action, which looks great. I like this change. Comments inline are minor issues.'}, {'account_id': 25660, 'date': '2018-01-29 02:34:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-29 02:41:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Looks Great. Thanks Chaolei.'}, {'account_id': 22076, 'date': '2018-01-31 08:37:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-01 02:23:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

Here is the error: http://logs.openstack.org/60/536260/2/gate/zun-tempest-docker-sql/5e5b501/logs/screen-zun-compute.txt.gz#_Jan_31_09_16_03_360140 . It looks there is a failure on deleting container.'}, {'account_id': 25660, 'date': '2018-02-01 05:20:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Here is the error: http://logs.openstack.org/60/536260/2/gate/zun-tempest-docker-sql/5e5b501/logs/screen-zun-compute.txt.gz#_Jan_31_09_16_03_360140
 > . It looks there is a failure on deleting container.

@Hongbin  That error occurred is because that when deleting a container, zun will also delete the container's db information. But in container_actions db, container_uuid is a foreign key reference container.uuid.  In order to solve this problem, before this patch, i have already drop the foreign key constraint in the patch :https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534225/ .   So, i don't know why that foreign key will appear again."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-01 15:53:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > Here is the error: http://logs.openstack.org/60/536260/2/gate/zun-tempest-docker-sql/5e5b501/logs/screen-zun-compute.txt.gz#_Jan_31_09_16_03_360140
 > > . It looks there is a failure on deleting container.
 > 
 > @Hongbin  That error occurred is because that when deleting a
 > container, zun will also delete the container's db information. But
 > in container_actions db, container_uuid is a foreign key reference
 > container.uuid.  In order to solve this problem, before this patch,
 > i have already drop the foreign key constraint in the patch
 > :https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534225/ .   So, i don't know why
 > that foreign key will appear again.

It is possibly due to this commit: https://github.com/openstack/zun/commit/506f8662712b4132b375516ef7ca6d93b4a35c3d#diff-2c52ba93b7cedbd4986ecd4787cff07c . Please feel free to re-propose patch to drop the foreign key."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-02 04:46:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-02 04:49:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Just rebase on a depending commit: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540235/'}, {'account_id': 22076, 'date': '2018-02-02 07:20:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

subject: Set ondelete='CASCADE' on foreign key
messages:
[{'account_id': 25660, 'date': '2018-02-02 03:28:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25660, 'date': '2018-02-02 03:41:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-02 04:35:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-02 04:40:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Chaolei,

After revisiting this patch, I think it is better to adopt an alternative approach. Instead of dropping the foreign key, let's alter the foreign key with an 'ondelete' parameter. This will make sure the database get cleanup when the container is deleted."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-02 04:46:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 25660, 'date': '2018-02-02 05:59:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> @Chaolei,
 > 
 > After revisiting this patch, I think it is better to adopt an
 > alternative approach. Instead of dropping the foreign key, let's
 > alter the foreign key with an 'ondelete' parameter. This will make
 > sure the database get cleanup when the container is deleted.

Great!  I think this approach is much better ! Thanks a lot for your help. :)
I also need learn something more about database."}, {'account_id': 25660, 'date': '2018-02-02 06:31:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-02 16:31:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22076, 'date': '2018-02-03 06:50:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536713/. In order to avoid the bug

commit_message:
Set ondelete='CASCADE' on foreign key

This commit actually do the samething as this patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534225/ did. But this commit will
update db after the patch "Some DB version is missing":
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536713/. In order to avoid the bug
https://bugs.launchpad.net/zun/+bug/1744881. This commit changes the
'ForeignKey' attribute with ondelete='CASCADE' in ContainerAction
and ContainerActionEvent model.

Change-Id: Ib91cc31569a7a3ccc324f36626b4c186ba0b060c

commit_message:
Don't run deploy jobs for docs-only changes

This change adds .rst and doc/ to the list of irrelevant files
for the gate jobs in order to allow only the openstack-docs gate job
to run when a change only affects documentation.

Change-Id: Ie55bbe21433781e5e89896efea83cbc7956085d0

commit_message:
Switch ec2-api gate job to use ec2api tempest plugin

ec2api tempest plugin[1] is ready to use for testing the
ec2-api in gate.

This patch moves the 'functional-neutron-dsvm-ec2api'
job to run test from plugin.

next patch will use the plugin for other job too if needed
and remove the in-tree tests on successful execution.

.. 1 https://github.com/openstack/ec2api-tempest-plugin

Change-Id: I31b59008f76981b832cb2f7a651858c5c02d494f

commit_message:
Remove deprecated io_loop argument

The argument io_loop on the ioloop.PeriodicCallback constructor is
deprecated in newer tornado versions, so we can just remove it.

Since we are using tornado<=4.5.2 on stable/pike, we can correctly set
master's version to tornado>=4.5.3.

Story: 2001489
Task: 6218

Change-Id: Id621d5b609e1bf4eac3a3dd4aff44436dd012b87

commit_message:
Add messages for testing unicode

These messages can be used for testing unicode in monasca-log-api and
monasca-tempest-plugin.

Change-Id: I51843dcda5059599a87e3e136a75faa25da67660

commit_message:
Fix the rabbitmq fd limits validation

After containerization of the rabbitmq service the `rabbitmqctl` call that is
made to determine the file descriptor limits doesn't give the expected results
any more (since it's executed outside of the container where the service is
running).

This patch looks up the container id with the `docker ps` command and executes
`rabbitmqctl` inside of the container.

Partial-Bug: #1744322
Change-Id: If9b09c5f43dd434f17135ba632cb6a424fd461db

commit_message:
Fixing create_secgroup_rules in scenario tests base

The current code is changing the rule_list parameter.
The method now return the list of created rules

Change-Id: I95a83adca6c2005bfad6987b94578b551d3672e4

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/ocata as commit 3c6fd9764850ad7926a195931e70a2650e5f12d8'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2017-06-15 04:38:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

@Brian: The question is what the expected lifetime of these test will be. The original idea by Kevin and myself was to have a simple copy of the tests that are in Tempest in order to have coverage here of some scenarios that are still lacking the proper client support in Cirros. So in the long run we would still hope that the tests would some time soonish end up in Tempest and can be removed again here. With that in mind, I just copied the code from Tempest and tweaked it until it worked here.

If instead you are targeting for a permanent solution here, that would be fine, too. But you would need to find someone other than me to perform that task, as I don't have enough time for that. You would also have to consider how much gate time you want to spend spinning up these full Ubuntu images."}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2017-06-16 02:59:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: -Code-Review

Jens - I didn't know you had talked to Kevin about doing it this way.  I'll clear my -1 and see what he says now that I've added him to the review."}, {'account_id': 7787, 'date': '2017-06-30 19:57:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

is it possible for us to subclass the tempest test case in the tempest repo and just override whatever is necessary?'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2017-07-06 10:53:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

recheck for regressions'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2017-07-06 10:55:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

@Kevin: I don't think that would be a good idea, as these are tempest internal IIUC, so depending on them might be pretty unstable

commit_message:
Add scenario tests for IPv6

Currently the scenario tests are only working with IPv4 based subnets.
Since the testing of DHCPv6 based scenarios in Tempest[1] is also still
blocked by Cirros not having a proper DHCPv6 client yet[2], we copy
these tests from tempest/scenario/test_network_v6.py so that they can
run with an Ubuntu based image here.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/386525
[2] https://review.openstack.org/385875

Change-Id: I8aeb58075baf6c9760f8ced27372b3e57274b9e2
Partial-Bug: 1509924

commit_message:
Fix the haproxy config file location

The location of the haproxy config file changed after the service was
containerized. This patch fixes the location to make the HAProxy validation
work again.

Partial-Bug: #1744322
Change-Id: Ifdfb5bc68b270ed14ab21bc7f7051a3dad157b5d

commit_message:
Fix PostgreSQL dataloss on pod restart

- Make data volume mount path configurable
- Use volumeMount subPath to avoid 'lost+found' in PVC
- Set PGDATA env to match data volume mount path

Change-Id: I5988ae663d21dd09f6edece9e380a001b3a2d2df

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: If77e8a375fe6eb7fa13312148557a18f8f8d23dc

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I33e07a13e581fc86c8e16ed4677f7b795e4523d5

[{'created': '2018-02-01 00:23:23.000000000', 'message': 'Unable to perform backup on DB2 instance

models.DatastoreSchema() needs to be initialized
with a database name.

This change fix the backup on DB2 instance

Change-Id: I95a9c60cd2406d4aa3b6ee52c654b2590a8d7e03
Closes-Bug: #1746626

commit_message:
Unable to perform backup on DB2 instance

models.DatastoreSchema() needs to be initialized
with a database name.

This change fix the backup on DB2 instance

Change-Id: I95a9c60cd2406d4aa3b6ee52c654b2590a8d7e03
Closes-Bug: #1746626

commit_message:
Use metadata IP as DHCP service IP for subnet without gateway IP

Currently, OVN does not support DHCP for subnet without gateway IP.
This is an important feature for VMs having multi ports on multi
subnets, because two conflicting default routes should be avoided.
In the patch[1] in OVN, router option was changed from mandatory to
optional, then we can add DHCP without router option to OVN. But,
without gateway IP, we still need an IP address as DHCP service IP,
using the same IP with metadata is a choice.
This patch does not solve all the problems, a TODO is added in the
code and bug is still opening to track it.

[1]https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/b89d25e5694bc9bb0a1fbb2a025d18a2a231c633

Conflicts:
        networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py

Change-Id: Icd93101bf8834a56f80184f0584a73a36b16b483
Partial-Bug: #1670666
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
(cherry picked from commit 48c3fbb8b830b4fb33fa63b1e7628c8d364509c2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 15:37:46.000000000', 'message': "Don't rely on parse.urlencode in url comparisons

The tests for allocation_candidates query parameters in test_report.py
relied on urlencode with a dict arg to create the expected_url that is
compared with the actual URL that the report client creates when
communicating with the placement service.

This is risky because the ordering of the query parameters is
not reliable when the source data is a dict. This change expands
the tests where it was used to do more explicit comparisons.

Change-Id: I2e51a4574b20c0634ad83a53c0e68261bbf0ac82
Closes-Bug: #1747001
"}]
commit_message:
Don't rely on parse.urlencode in url comparisons

The tests for allocation_candidates query parameters in test_report.py
relied on urlencode with a dict arg to create the expected_url that is
compared with the actual URL that the report client creates when
communicating with the placement service.

This is risky because the ordering of the query parameters is
not reliable when the source data is a dict. This change expands
the tests where it was used to do more explicit comparisons.

Change-Id: I2e51a4574b20c0634ad83a53c0e68261bbf0ac82
Closes-Bug: #1747001

subject: Accept the IBM DB2 license during the DIB process
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 16:15:36.000000000', 'message': 'Accept the IBM DB2 license during the DIB process

During the DB2 installation, the db2_install
process asks a question about the license. Disk
Image Builder will hang until "yes" or "no" is
manually entered.

db2_install script provides the "-y" option to
accept automatically the license.

From db2_install help:
  Specifies that you have read and agreed to the
  license agreement file in the db2/license
  directory on the CD. This parameter is mandatory
  when -n is specified.

Change-Id: I8a8330adc41cbed60c8472f925b10cf816aed44e
Closes-Bug: #1747031
'}]
commit_message:
Accept the IBM DB2 license during the DIB process

During the DB2 installation, the db2_install
process asks a question about the license. Disk
Image Builder will hang until "yes" or "no" is
manually entered.

db2_install script provides the "-y" option to
accept automatically the license.

From db2_install help:
  Specifies that you have read and agreed to the
  license agreement file in the db2/license
  directory on the CD. This parameter is mandatory
  when -n is specified.

Change-Id: I8a8330adc41cbed60c8472f925b10cf816aed44e
Closes-Bug: #1747031

commit_message:
Update senlin support to use openstacksdk instead

python-senlinclient is actually just a thin wrapper around
python-openstacksdk. Instead of reworking the constructor in the Senlin
plugin to be upwards-compatible with the upcoming python-openstacksdk
release, just remove use of python-senlinclient and use the openstacksdk
client plugin instead.

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-01-29 09:22:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-01-29 12:50:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

this is all fine, a couple points though:

- this script only sends requests to services on the undercloud and undercloud services are not restarted during installation or upgrade of the overcloud. basically, anytime you are running this script, undercloud services should *not* be restarting. If they are, this script does not do what you think it does :).

- this script is not needed when using config-download on initial deployment. are you running it for upgrades for some reason? Even so, os-collect-config should already be configured on nodes you are upgrading.

- even when not using config-download, there is an alternative to using this script with the DeploymentSwiftDataMap Heat parameter which is a cleaner approach imo.'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-01-29 13:55:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

@James Slagle

This script covers 2 issues:

1. Restart of undercloud openstack service during deployment. However, this is side effect of what I am trying to achieve

2. The real purpose is race conditions we obtained running this script against m1.medium undercloud with swap.

I am attaching /var/log/deployed-server-os-collect-config.log from env with this script http://paste.openstack.org/show/656922/

It was generated on m1.medium undercloud.
Let me summarize some facts

1. 320 seconds between first attempt and successul attempt of 
openstack stack resource list overcloud

3. line 192 of http://paste.openstack.org/show/656922/. We've got empty output thus fail_if_empty returned -1 and we had to sleep (line 206)
2. line 302 of http://paste.openstack.org/show/656922/ We've got empty output once again
thus we had one more sleep (line 315)"}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-01-29 15:49:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

thanks.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-01-29 18:17:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Workflow-1

Reseting the gate to release milestone 3, I'll re-approve this patch asap."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-01-29 18:17:21.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-01-29 18:19:50.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-01-29 18:19:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-01-30 09:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

reverify'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-01-31 09:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Introduce wait_backoff, fail_if_empty wrappers

* wait_backoff wrapper retries the command several time increasing backoff
  timeout exponentially. Its log is added to to stderr. All openstack calls were
  refactored to to try several time as services may be restarted during
  installation or upgrade.

* fail_if_empty wrapper fails if no output received.

* Some openstack commands were wrapped as there is a deplay between stack and
  resource creation. Usually it's not visible. However, when undercloud is
  located on small VM or cloud flavour is m1.medium then it creates a race
  condition may occur in some places.

Minor:
- let was replaced to ((i++)), for speed reason.
- sleep was added to while true, just not to abuse openstack services.

Change-Id: I435042e6f7fdfcb38d04b055ba437f273d0bfe75

commit_message:
trivial: Resolve Python 3 issues

Resolve the following exception:

  AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'decode'

This wasn't caught in the gate because that still uses Python 2.7. This
is not the case in other environments (Fedora 27).

Change-Id: I6b462f19432c4cf9948cddcc095d9d5a85feeb4b

Added uninstall information

This patch set adds additional instruction to clean and reset a
development environment.

Hi Tim,

in my opinion iothreads should always be enabled with current libvirt/qemu versions and native IO mode should be enabled for storage backends where performance increases in this mode. So I do not see a need for additional configuration options in the flavor or image.

The caching mode can already be set in nova.conf via disk_cachemodes for different backends (file, block). I did not intend to change the cache mode behavior with this blueprint.

If you have ideas on how to improve the cache mode configuration, maybe I can include it.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2015-10-05 14:09:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

With all of the TODOs it seems this is a work in progress.

I'd really want explicit detail about the minimum required versions of libvirt/qemu required for this and which platforms are supported since the libvirt driver supports intel, pkvm and zkvm.

I think you should also discuss any impacts to live migration earlier in the spec since it was noted in the testing section."}, {'account_id': 14594, 'date': '2015-10-09 13:43:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14594, 'date': '2015-10-09 13:48:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
libvirt: iothreads for disk devices

Accelerate disk IO performance by exploiting iothreads, which were
introduced in recent libvirt/qemu releases.

Change-Id: I8ae0b5af77aa7c6eccd42d67dc703d4ac9d2b07b
Co-Authored-By: Alexander Schmidt <alexs@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Implements: blueprint libvirt-iothreads

messages: [{'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-02-02 20:58:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-02-02 21:02:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:\n\nThis playbook is currently used by the publish-governance-sigs, publish-governance-tc, publish-governance-uc, publish-governance-website and publish-security jobs. As an added safety measure, I have tarred up copies of the content for all of them. That said, synchronize needs a non-default delete parameter to make it actually delete content at the destination so it shouldn't be an issue."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-02 21:36:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-02-02 21:39:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 20:58:42.000000000', 'message': 'Switch static-special from copy to synchronize

According to notes in the Ansible documentation for the copy module,
it "does not scale to lots (>hundreds) of files." Several of the 5
sites currently relying on the publish/static-special playbook have
content numbering in the thousands of files. Other sites on the same
server instead rely on the publish/static playbook which already
uses synchronize instead of copy, so this should be entirely
compatible.

Change-Id: Iac85d906ae7c7a4666d7a5eeaa73b5a9f2ac7115
'}]
commit_message:
Switch static-special from copy to synchronize

According to notes in the Ansible documentation for the copy module,
it "does not scale to lots (>hundreds) of files." Several of the 5
sites currently relying on the publish/static-special playbook have
content numbering in the thousands of files. Other sites on the same
server instead rely on the publish/static playbook which already
uses synchronize instead of copy, so this should be entirely
compatible.

Change-Id: Iac85d906ae7c7a4666d7a5eeaa73b5a9f2ac7115

commit_message:
fix same mechanism driver called twice bug

when a mechinism driver calls context.continue_binding to
continue binding, it will be called again because
_check_driver_to_bind compares driver name with driver.

Closes-Bug: #1745572
Change-Id: I62b32c9b9d01dd929fe8cd3634c78dc0cbe325b6

Makes sense, thanks for digging into this. I wonder why this just started cropping up recently though?'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-01-31 21:34:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Makes sense, thanks for digging into this. I wonder why this just
 > started cropping up recently though?

That I don't know :( It also seems pretty strange for the unit tests to be using more than 151 connections. I think all or at least most of the mysql connections come from test_sql_upgrade.py, so maybe just the fact that we've added a bunch of migrations recently brought it over the edge?"}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-02-02 19:08:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-02-02 19:08:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}]

"}]
commit_message:
Increase MySQL max_connections for unit tests

We've seen that sometimes our unit tests create a lot of mysql
connections simultaneously[1][2] and cause the tests to fail. Increase
the max_connections limit from 151 to 1024, which is what devstack
uses[3].

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/43/536543/9/check/openstack-tox-py35/0729ea7/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-30_19_36_38_136523
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/23/524423/44/gate/openstack-tox-py35/0f8083f/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-28_21_11_52_855308
[3] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/devstack/tree/lib/databases/mysql?id=640150683d137a9a10dfe833e7a34b7ea6cdfb1a#n99

Change-Id: Ic9f9ca696af1876eb5a728356a98d70352ef9bc3
Related-bug: #1746016

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Idd657dbe6443dd4d69934d2c973a2249a76cc795

commit_message:
SFC: Agent extension fixes

* Fix delete_port behavior: Calls to ports detach in bagpipe-bgp where missing
* Fix sfc_ports_detach: Properly update port chain hops informations
* Adjust how synchronization is done
* Remove unnecessary mask from IP prefixies

Update corresponding unit tests.

Signed-off-by: Thomas Morin <thomas.morin@orange.com>
Submitted on behalf of a third-party: Orange

Change-Id: I75665ec9413a8b75f91025ecdee3dc2a6acf9482

messages:
[{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-02 20:30:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-02 21:10:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Chris already had a patch for this:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540420'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 20:30:51.000000000', 'message': 'Fix test_get_allocation_candidates tests

These tests randomly fail based on the hash seed used
when encoding the URL based on the dict inputs. This
fixes the tests by mocking out the keystoneauth1.get()
method to parse the URL and compare the query string
dict values properly, that is, regardless of order.

Change-Id: I438641d95ad07193bdcafc69dab9f6099ecca92b
Closes-Bug: #1747063
'}]
commit_message:
Fix test_get_allocation_candidates tests

These tests randomly fail based on the hash seed used
when encoding the URL based on the dict inputs. This
fixes the tests by mocking out the keystoneauth1.get()
method to parse the URL and compare the query string
dict values properly, that is, regardless of order.

Change-Id: I438641d95ad07193bdcafc69dab9f6099ecca92b
Closes-Bug: #1747063

subject: add scenario to create / delete subnets in parallel threads
messages:
[{'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-01-29 21:46:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-01-29 21:47:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-01-29 21:49:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This scenario attempts to pre-create a network, then create / delete 1 subnet per concurrent thread in the same network, in hope of triggering race conditions inside IPAM allocation code.

Andrey, could you please check if this addition makes sense from rally perspective? (I haven't been able to execute the scenario locally so far because of configuration issues, but I am interested in whether the approach I take is even feasible.)"}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-01-29 21:52:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-01-30 14:37:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

It will be part of rally instead: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540041/'}]

commit_message:
add scenario to create / delete subnets in parallel threads

A lot of IP allocation races can be found if we trigger IPAM code in parallel
threads. So far, no existing rally or tempest scenario ever did it.

Change-Id: Iebea2969d2ed106074677d836043776d30870e42

commit_message:
Fix openstack-service-setup.yml GATEWAY_NETWORK to match the flat network.

  This should allow the proper gateway ip to be used for connectivity to/from
  vms in the GATEWAY_NETWORK or with floating ips from it.

Change-Id: I0f4498baa2edbf24bbf2c407c6e5a2574454cfdc
Closes-Bug: 1746621

subject: Add availability zone parameters for volume required template
messages:
[{'account_id': 26721, 'date': '2017-12-14 04:41:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26721, 'date': '2017-12-14 04:44:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 26721, 'date': '2017-12-14 05:11:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2017-12-14 12:00:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

What happens if you don't specify the new parameters in the ini file? Can we add a default value?"}, {'account_id': 26721, 'date': '2017-12-14 12:35:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

It will fail the test with error "availability_zone is not defined". Yes, we can have a default value, but anyway, the real az name in the tested system should be used here. So do you think we can add a default name like "nova"?'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2017-12-14 16:50:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yes, that's the idea. If the parameter is not specified in the ini file, and if it matches the default (which should probably be whatever devstack deployes), the code should still work as before).
At least one of the ini file for the unit tests should be without those values, thus relying on the defaults."}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2017-12-14 17:23:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2017-12-14 17:34:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 26721, 'date': '2017-12-15 00:21:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-02 15:31:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-02-02 18:21:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Add availability zone parameters for volume required template

Since some default templates require volume, add the availability
zone parameters for them. Otherwise the volume creation will fail.

Change-Id: I2bcfc2c395f9c685270a77eb4ef23b37c0d2f876

commit_message:
Add basic bash completion to --no-discover arg

This commit adds support for doing bash completion to ostestr. It adds
basic support to do argument completion as well as adding module
searching to the --no-discover command to aid in selecting the module
to use.

Change-Id: I4e06201fc225d49d3b7bedde9beb97476cf1caa0

Pass parameters when create eventlet.wsgi server

Otherwise, config option wsgi_log_format in neutron.conf
will not work

Closes-Bug: #1672615

Change-Id: I49693a7968e820010751909a48f06f3f784c5721
"}, {'created': '2018-02-02 15:02:24.000000000', 'message': "[jsonschema] Require specifying `additionalProperties` explicitly

Validation of objects via jsonschema become meaningless if there is no

commit_message:
[jsonschema] Require specifying `additionalProperties` explicitly

Validation of objects via jsonschema become meaningless if there is no
`additionalProperties: False`. In case of complex schemas, it is easy to
miss this property in some child property.

Let's require always specifing additionalProperties to simplify the life
of reviewers and do not miss anything.

Change-Id: I49693a7968e820010751909a48f06f3f784c5721

commit_message:
Update keystone Auth_url

Update the ironic-inspector auth?_url to be http (not https) on
localhost (not the fddn) and v3 (not v2.0)

Change-Id: I65c6b54ad3fc815711ffa2e1eadb6d81fa9b8420
Depends-On: Ia363e7eca12157e0b15b29b4d517c75e07d596de

Adding fuse package to Ambari

In order for Ambari to work properly on Rhel we need to install fuse package
on the image.

Closes-bug: #1746712
(cherry picked from commit dfc914ccfed23d306ee79dab00952dffa16e85b4)

This change converts the usage of self.<provider_api> to
keystone.common.providers_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> in manager
and controller logic. This is the correct way to reference
providers from other managers and controllers now that dependency
injection has been eliminated.

commit_message:
Use keystone.common.provider_api for policy APIs

This change converts the usage of self.<provider_api> to
keystone.common.providers_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> in manager
and controller logic. This is the correct way to reference
providers from other managers and controllers now that dependency
injection has been eliminated.

Change-Id: Ieea66d86d6d28ac105c4c39bdea1d05aec8e0c46

subject: Fix SELinux file contexts for nova's ssh keys
messages: [{'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-01 13:26:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-02 18:26:37.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned\n\nNevermind. I don't think we need this in Pike."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-01 13:26:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix SELinux file contexts for nova's ssh keys

The original SELinux file context equivalance that was added for
/var/lib/nova was too broad and needs to be made more specific.

This patch removes the old equivalence record and replaces it with
a specific file context rule. This allows live migrations to work
with CentOS 7 systems that have SELinux in enforcing mode.

Closes-Bug: 1742732
Depends-On: I52901ac48f9a95d0fe6b010f5940b5c39fce1aba
Change-Id: I8f7c750edc1c7b354343f07230eb17d1357001de
(cherry picked from commit 1a483db8d0fd629dc792c6160c182def57ee3ad3)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix SELinux file contexts for nova's ssh keys

The original SELinux file context equivalance that was added for
/var/lib/nova was too broad and needs to be made more specific.

This patch removes the old equivalence record and replaces it with
a specific file context rule. This allows live migrations to work
with CentOS 7 systems that have SELinux in enforcing mode.

Closes-Bug: 1742732
Depends-On: I52901ac48f9a95d0fe6b010f5940b5c39fce1aba
Change-Id: I8f7c750edc1c7b354343f07230eb17d1357001de
(cherry picked from commit 1a483db8d0fd629dc792c6160c182def57ee3ad3)

commit_message:
During mixed version upgrade overcloud image tags may be used.

When doing mixed upgrade if we use the docker_image_tag we get master
build id.  But we want master-1 build id.

Used with the depends on, we can have both tag for more flexibility.

Change-Id: I185a1f2c3fd2f61864b5e554ed6df4a2b438b9bc
Depends-On: I468e14d746fd5ab5a51485ee9b907efc44391c56
Related-Bug: #1745348

Depending on how things merge into a branch, the --first-parent option
might give us the wrong version. For example, python-troveclient at
26425a6 was showing 2.13.0 instead of the correct 2.14.0. Remove the
option to fix that problem.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix get_last_tag function

Depending on how things merge into a branch, the --first-parent option
might give us the wrong version. For example, python-troveclient at
26425a6 was showing 2.13.0 instead of the correct 2.14.0. Remove the
option to fix that problem.

Change-Id: I9a6996b03dc74df6963ac96887356bc6094e59b7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
show type in list-deliverables output when more than one option

If the user does not filter on type, or filters on multiple types, show
the type in the verbose output of list-deliverables.

Change-Id: Id4c1f7dcb540f4a15634d6bcd9c1da78792e7d68
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Missing VNIC type parameter when using it to create a port

In the project creation port page, regardless of the choice of VNIC
Type, the created port VNIC Type is displayed as Normal, since the
creation port does not specify the 'binding__vnic_type' parameter.

Change-Id: I29700b29e163363dbd7c85a2d5c68c8a6b635ee6
Closes-Bug:#1746977

commit_message:
bgpvpn: provide 'descriptions' in agent extension

This allows to have useful information about BGPVPN
in bagpipe-looking-glass:

$ bagpipe-looking-glass vpns instances
* ipvpn_b20df8a0-262e-45f0-af75-3d1b311c9f8f (...)
  description: BGPVPN association for net b20df8a0-262e-45f0-af75-3d1b311c9f8f (10.101.11.1)
  name: VRF-5
* ipvpn_d587188f-6f91-4ef4-8870-4bb241476329 (...)
  description: BGPVPN association for net d587188f-6f91-4ef4-8870-4bb241476329 (10.103.31.1)
  name: VRF-1
* ipvpn_c78d82e7-5ddf-420b-8dbb-da8e9ed80c65 (...)
  description: BGPVPN association for net c78d82e7-5ddf-420b-8dbb-da8e9ed80c65 (10.102.21.1)
  name: VRF-4

Change-Id: Id70b76bf14b3f7022ebc2dad1b6b30cdd7d822b6

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-02-01 17:31:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-02-01 17:32:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 22818, 'date': '2018-02-01 18:38:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18665, 'date': '2018-02-01 19:02:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2018-02-02 16:09:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Looks good. Thanks!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-25 22:11:24.000000000', 'message': 'Improve Vertica 9.x support

During the Vertica installation, the install script try to get AWS
metadata even if --ignore-aws-instance-type is specified.

The only way to avoid the _get_macs error is to define
--ignore-install-config option.

During the cluster creation, if the process is too long, Vertica
ask a question:
  Do you want to continue waiting? (yes/no) [yes]

From the adminTools documentation there is no non-interactive or
timeout options. The only way to have this question answered is
to run "echo yes | " before the "adminTools -t create_db" command.

Change-Id: I94472082fac606f4ff14f26c2ca2b620ef0a3bbb
'}, {'created': '2018-01-25 22:12:04.000000000', 'message': 'Improve Vertica 9.x support

During the Vertica installation, the install script try to get AWS
metadata even if --ignore-aws-instance-type is specified.

The only way to avoid the _get_macs error is to define
--ignore-install-config option.

During the cluster creation, if the process is too long, Vertica
ask a question:
  Do you want to continue waiting? (yes/no) [yes]

From the adminTools documentation there is no non-interactive or
timeout options. The only way to have this question answered is
to run "echo yes | " before the "adminTools -t create_db" command.

Closes-Bug: #1745493
Change-Id: I94472082fac606f4ff14f26c2ca2b620ef0a3bbb

commit_message:
Improve Vertica 9.x support

During the Vertica installation, the install script try to get AWS
metadata even if --ignore-aws-instance-type is specified.

The only way to avoid the _get_macs error is to define
--ignore-install-config option.

During the cluster creation, if the process is too long, Vertica
ask a question:
  Do you want to continue waiting? (yes/no) [yes]

From the adminTools documentation there is no non-interactive or
timeout options. The only way to have this question answered is
to run "echo yes | " before the "adminTools -t create_db" command.

The only available version from Vertica website is 9.0.1.

Closes-Bug: #1745493
Change-Id: I94472082fac606f4ff14f26c2ca2b620ef0a3bbb

commit_message:
Fix senlin/sdk client plugin unit tests

New python-openstacksdk has broken the client plugins.
This also change to use `status_code` instead of `http_status`
of HttpException when checking for bad request.

Closes-Bug: #1746956
Change-Id: Ib1f295a6dea014df3237acf0efd6b84464eac9c1

commit_message:
Allow ability to configure number of processes and threads

Users can configure the number of worker threads however when it's
not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs.

This also adds the setting of threads and processes to the UWSGI
configuration.

Change-Id: I003ab426488966cce46bd6fd297c79ada13c9668
Closes-Bug: #1745631
(cherry picked from commit 4b0da513d06ebffad24490b9b08eb2033ee6a181)

commit_message:
Disable mistral cron-trigger subsystem

Disabling cron trigger subsystem allows to significantly increase
system performance by reducing the constant load on the processor and
the database. Since the subsystem is going to be deprecated in Mistral
soon, there is no reason to keep it enabled for TripleO.

Change-Id: I7587f1ae54a5f30743d78822b45f8aed5ba13495

commit_message:
Add ironic-inspector and iptables to captured logs

Add iptables output so we can validate the firewall config.

Also if ironic is enabled there is a good chnace that we also want to
log the ironic-inspector config/logs

Change-Id: Ia363e7eca12157e0b15b29b4d517c75e07d596de

subject: Set OS_INTERFACE and OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE in auth file
messages:
[{'account_id': 27766, 'date': '2018-02-01 18:15:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-02-01 18:15:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-02-01 20:17:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-02-02 15:43:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

[{'created': '2018-02-01 18:15:40.000000000', 'message': 'Set OS_INTERFACE and OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE in auth file

OSC does not use service-specific environment variables for choosing
endpoints. It requires a common OS_INTERFACE variable that is used for
--os-interface.
OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE is the analog for older service-specific clients and is
used for --os-endpoint-type.

Change-Id: I5dd8de00e72631d578cf7e0b7028705a5cda1ddb
'}]
commit_message:
Set OS_INTERFACE and OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE in auth file

OSC does not use service-specific environment variables for choosing
endpoints. It requires a common OS_INTERFACE variable that is used for
--os-interface.
OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE is the analog for older service-specific clients and is
used for --os-endpoint-type.

Change-Id: I5dd8de00e72631d578cf7e0b7028705a5cda1ddb

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I30deb483498da88ad557bff24cb9c6235086bc07

commit_message:
Make requirements voting again, update .zuul.yaml

Change  Ibc77ea864503e63f73be0f1c41e07bfe8ea3dcae needed a non-voting
requirements change for merging, since this is in, we can make
requirements voting again. For this, just remove it.

Remove voting from the neutron-tempest-plugin-designate job since
non-voting jobs should not run in gate.

Remove name from project-stanza, this is not needed anymore.

Rename designate grenade job to follow
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#naming-with-zuul-v3

Change-Id: I794bd13bf74d2218e64b9f9922ea8abd6c9b33a0

from python-ec2-api-tests to python-ec2api-tests-tempest

commit_message:
Adding fuse package to Ambari

In order for Ambari to work properly on Rhel we need to install fuse package
on the image.

Change-Id: I27b661b2da83776e382da962c89b9098599524d0
Closes-bug: #1746712

commit_message:
Update historical context about the removal of v2.0

This commit updates some of our contributor documentation to
accurately describe the v2.0 situation, now that we've removed
support for it.

Change-Id: Iffd59b81bc269ce67814199b024a034386d74e0c

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Icd4ce951cd20570343af18fe6e7374f6ea9f79cb

commit_message:
Revert "Remove team:diverse-affiliation from tags"

The diverse-affiliation tag was restored to Glance on 2017-09-05
by change I9c61fb6d09a51adbe0a3b4bf2098ec1c98ea33e1

This reverts commit 3dae473c3acfae16cd3f51eea6367fbf289591cc.

Change-Id: I389375c47de56fdfdfa3aa8fbf28086a44b00d78

subject: Retire the trove-integration repository
messages:
[{'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2017-10-25 14:16:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-10-25 14:22:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

EOL of newton is done.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-10-25 14:23:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

remvoe the .git* files as well'}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2017-10-25 14:31:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2017-10-25 14:32:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Andreas, people still refer others to trove-integration on (for example) IRC, even though it has not been updated in eons. So I'm looking to just empty out the repo and just leave the readme.md for a release.

Having the empty repo for a release won't be as good of a user experience as just removing the repo. Fine with that as well, just wanted to give one more release ..."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-10-25 14:35:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Amrith, we do not remove content - this will stay.

We just will disable - as explained in https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project - changes for it. So, freeze it.

So, let's do all four steps - and people can still checkout this any time."}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2017-10-25 14:48:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-10-25 14:51:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Propose to retire the trove-integration soon.'}, {'account_id': 25113, 'date': '2018-01-18 07:59:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Amrith has sent a warning mail and here it is :http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-July/119825.html'}, {'account_id': 22694, 'date': '2018-01-18 07:59:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Hi,Kumar,I think the work of trove-integration into trove has been done for a long time, and it looks like it can be merged, but do we need to email for formal notification?'}, {'account_id': 22818, 'date': '2018-02-02 16:25:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Fair warning has been provided. Once in Juky 2017 and the next one in Jan 2018. No one has provided a reason to keep this around.'}]

commit_message:
Move Linuxbridge ARP spoofing to nat table PREROUTING chain

It was found that adding ebtables rules to the filter table
FORWARD chain could be vulnerable to a DoS attack.  Moving
to the nat table PREROUTING chain should mitigate this as
it is consulted prior to allowing the frame in.

In order to make this work with upgrades, had to make the code
detect and remove any old rules that might still exist in
the filter table.  That can be removed after a cycle.

Added some unit tests in addition to the existing functional
tests.

Change-Id: I87852b21db4404c58c83789cc267812030ac7d5f
Closes-bug: #1732294

commit_message:
Update requirements manually

The global requirments sync for this repo fails since it lists
packages that are not in the global list. Manually sync
requirements.

Failure log from requirements sync:
http://logs.openstack.org/d8/d89aad257d43fe02e42e44b2a0187dbd9f505c36/post/propose-update-requirements/15a7777/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-31_06_51_56_655451

Errors are:
'discover' is not in global-requirements.txt or blacklist.txt
'dpath' is not in global-requirements.txt or blacklist.txt
'salt' is not in global-requirements.txt or blacklist.txt
'yamllint' is not in global-requirements.txt or blacklist.txt

Change-Id: Ifbd174d568b0cae5225faa6e25b1bc5fc4774e6e

commit_message:
monasca: backport Cassandra support

This commit backports the following patches required for
supporting the Cassandra time series database in Monasca:

monasca-api:
  * cassandra-527858.patch: adds metrics retrieval from
    Cassandra and thoroughly overhauls/fixes Cassandra support
    in Devstack.
  * cassandra-auth-533833.patch: adds support for
    authenticated Cassandra access.
  * cassandra-statistics-api-end-time-529788.patch: fixes statistics
    API for unspecified end time.
monasca-agent:
  * monitor-cassandra-538096.patch: adds detection plugin for
    the Cassandra service.
monasca-persister:
  * cassandra-527855.patch: adds support for storing metrics
    in Cassandra.

Change-Id: I17bb8195969eb697d3f126edfc0395bb338c805f

"}]
commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: support VPN instance and attachment descriptions

New 'instance_description' and attachment 'description' fields
can be defined via bagpipe-bgp API. They are then exposed to
provide helpful hints in the API.

Change-Id: I5c5b5abb60e2f2a817d180a0486e77c158f269bc

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

remove also tox-linters job, it cannot work since no linters environment
exists.

Change-Id: I259ce9991e748f3661e7a828c1fc1f6485404cc6

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ia022dbaa1f3e1cb5412bd92d4c9ce0df03521048

subject: Move implemented spec to 'implemented'
messages:
[{'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-10-30 16:07:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-10-30 19:48:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

You may run into issues with sphinx if any of the specs documents define hyperlink targets because with a symlink they will be defined twice. You could use redirects, instead. https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/redirects.html

If that doesn't work for the specs docs we can update infra so it does."}, {'account_id': 26734, 'date': '2017-10-30 20:19:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-10-31 21:31:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Will try Doug's suggestion.  That would entail moving the actual doc from approved -> implemented as we used to do, but then adding a redirect so that a URL to specs/queens/approved/glance/deprecate-registry.html will be redirected to the new location."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-11-08 04:47:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26734, 'date': '2017-11-08 15:33:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2017-11-15 07:03:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-11-27 14:27:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-11-27 21:59:18.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I couldn't get the .htaccess file to be included in the build output without updating a bunch of stuff, so abandoning this in favor of https://review.openstack.org/523233"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-02 18:41:06.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

Relevant again now that https://review.openstack.org/523233 and https://review.openstack.org/523472 have merged.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-02 18:41:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-01 14:22:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Looks correct to me.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-02-01 14:23:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-02-02 13:35:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Workflow+1

I'm going to ninja this in, it's the only way to see if the redirects actually work in this repo."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-02-02 15:13:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Looks like it's working!

devVM! curl -I http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/glance-specs/specs/queens/approved/glance/deprecate-registry.html
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Fri, 02 Feb 2018 15:11:13 GMT

ETag: "7463-5604e00797e81"
Accept-Ranges: bytes
Content-Length: 29795
Vary: Accept-Encoding
Content-Type: text/html

devVM! curl -I http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/glance-specs/specs/queens/implemented/glance/deprecate-registry.html
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Fri, 02 Feb 2018 15:11:26 GMT

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-30 16:07:43.000000000', 'message': "Symlink specs to 'implemented'

Update the specs repo to indicate the Q-1 implementations.  Beginning
with Queens, we've adopted the convention that all specs stay in the
'approved' directory, and implemented specs are indicated by a
symlink in the 'implemented' directory.  This will prevent breaking
any URLs that refer to the approved specs.

Change-Id: I8aac14f306f35d14ca06ca742f556ef8afb866fe
"}, {'created': '2017-11-08 04:47:31.000000000', 'message': "Move implemented spec to 'implemented'

Update the specs repo to indicate the Q-1 implementations.  This
commit includes a .htaccess file containing a line redirecting
requests that refer to the spec under the 'approved' path to the
new location of the file.

Change-Id: I8aac14f306f35d14ca06ca742f556ef8afb866fe
"}, {'created': '2017-11-27 14:27:08.000000000', 'message': "Move implemented spec to 'implemented'

Update the specs repo to indicate the Q-1 implementations.  This
commit includes a .htaccess file containing a line redirecting
requests that refer to the spec under the 'approved' path to the
new location of the file.

Change-Id: I8aac14f306f35d14ca06ca742f556ef8afb866fe
"}, {'created': '2017-12-02 18:41:13.000000000', 'message': "Move implemented spec to 'implemented'

Update the specs repo to indicate the Q-1 implementations.
This includes moving the spec, adding a redirect so the old
URL doesn't break, and adding a 'whereto' test.

Change-Id: I8aac14f306f35d14ca06ca742f556ef8afb866fe
"}]
commit_message:
Move implemented spec to 'implemented'

Update the specs repo to indicate the Q-1 implementations.
This includes moving the spec, adding a redirect so the old
URL doesn't break, and adding a 'whereto' test.

Change-Id: I8aac14f306f35d14ca06ca742f556ef8afb866fe

commit_message:
Fix upgrade test

openstacksdk was updated to 0.10.0 which has a different
connection.Connection object, which doesn't take our auth_url.

We should respect the constraints, install the tooling in a venv,
and restrict to a known version of the sdk until more robust code
is written.

Change-Id: I681d5177c3d62d4cd44371fef0032fa8a0727dfd

commit_message:
Fix upgrade test

openstacksdk was updated to 0.10.0 which has a different
connection.Connection object, which doesn't take our auth_url.

We should respect the constraints, install the tooling in a venv,
and restrict to a known version of the sdk until more robust code
is written.

Change-Id: Ib3d3d14a3a6222f4362def29b4765cf5bad3d285

commit_message:
Fix upgrade test

openstacksdk was updated to 0.10.0 which has a different
connection.Connection object, which doesn't take our auth_url.

We should respect the constraints, install the tooling in a venv,
and restrict to a known version of the sdk until more robust code
is written.

Change-Id: I0fb7872dbc2c295616c319cd7e373dd8e868b028
Depends-On: Ia78ea53a99923844f40fb4e9fe22ec0da4b0c335

commit_message:
Fix upgrade test

openstacksdk was updated to 0.10.0 which has a different
connection.Connection object, which doesn't take our auth_url.

We should respect the constraints, install the tooling in a venv,
and restrict to a known version of the sdk until more robust code
is written.

Change-Id: Ibcfe3d69705833b0c743e6303feb351a464abdcf

commit_message:
Add dsvm job

Add a single node dsvm job with neutron segments enabled on
the ironic-provisioning network.

networking_baremetal mech driver and ironic-neutron-agent
enabled.

Related-Bug: #1658964
Depends-On: I041761dd896c9d89dc6cf7bafc991a0697ded05b
Change-Id: Ib4d93937c3985e51e2c10ded26af96d47b747f00

messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-02 11:56:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-02 11:59:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-02 12:12:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-02 12:12:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:\n\n(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-02 12:25:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-02 12:43:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-02 13:05:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-02 13:19:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13095, 'date': '2018-02-02 13:49:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 11:56:42.000000000', 'message': "Properly ensure we use the right packages for each venv

The current method of simply removing the virtualenv_support
folder is a hack. In theory it's supposed to force a new
virtualenv to fetch the packages from upstream, but by using
this method, virtualenv can sometimes break when building a
new venv.

This patch implements a better method which achieves the same
goal, but does it using the tooling provided rather than the
previous hack.

Change-Id: I2c50bb693dc5dc505bddce34ff45294ac44f7dc9
Closes-Bug: #1746935
"}, {'created': '2018-02-02 11:59:28.000000000', 'message': "Properly ensure we use the right packages for each venv

The current method of simply removing the virtualenv_support
folder is a hack. In theory it's supposed to force a new
virtualenv to fetch the packages from upstream, but by using
this method, virtualenv can sometimes break when building a
new venv.

This patch implements a better method which achieves the same
goal, but does it using the tooling provided rather than the
previous hack.

Change-Id: I2c50bb693dc5dc505bddce34ff45294ac44f7dc9
Closes-Bug: #1746935
"}, {'created': '2018-02-02 12:12:00.000000000', 'message': "Properly ensure we use the right packages for each venv

The current method of simply removing the virtualenv_support
folder is a hack. It breaks virtualenv's ability to work
normally. In upgrades to Queens this is a problem as the
repo-server role sets up a virtualenv and needs it to work
normally.

This patch implements a better method which achieves the same
goal, but does it using the tooling provided rather than the
previous hack.

Change-Id: I2c50bb693dc5dc505bddce34ff45294ac44f7dc9
Closes-Bug: #1746935
"}, {'created': '2018-02-02 12:25:54.000000000', 'message': 'Prepare virtualenvs without breaking the virtualenv tooling

When preparing virtualenvs, we have an implementation which
tries to ensure that the versions of pip, setuptools and
wheel are the ones we want them to be. In order to do that
we have previously removed the virtualenv_support folder
which contains the pip/setuptools/wheel versions that
virtualenv shipped with. This was done to prevent any
leaking of the wrong version into the virtualenv and was
the only way of doing it with much earlier versions of
virtualenv.

We can now update the method of achieving the same goal
without breaking the virtualenv tooling, which this patch
does.

The virtualenv_support folder missing is causing the
repo-server role which uses virtualenv to fail in upgrades
to queens. That role needs a complete and properly working
version of virtualenv in place.

Change-Id: I2c50bb693dc5dc505bddce34ff45294ac44f7dc9
Closes-Bug: #1746935
'}, {'created': '2018-02-02 13:05:07.000000000', 'message': 'Prepare virtualenvs without breaking the virtualenv tooling

When preparing virtualenvs, we have an implementation which
tries to ensure that the versions of pip, setuptools and
wheel are the ones we want them to be. In order to do that
we have previously removed the virtualenv_support folder
which contains the pip/setuptools/wheel versions that
virtualenv shipped with. This was done to prevent any
leaking of the wrong version into the virtualenv and was
the only way of doing it with much earlier versions of
virtualenv.

We can now update the method of achieving the same goal
without breaking the virtualenv tooling, which this patch
does.

The virtualenv_support folder missing is causing the
repo-server role which uses virtualenv to fail in upgrades
to queens. That role needs a complete and properly working
version of virtualenv in place.

Change-Id: I2c50bb693dc5dc505bddce34ff45294ac44f7dc9
Closes-Bug: #1746935
'}]
commit_message:
Prepare virtualenvs without breaking the virtualenv tooling

When preparing virtualenvs, we have an implementation which
tries to ensure that the versions of pip, setuptools and
wheel are the ones we want them to be. In order to do that
we have previously removed the virtualenv_support folder
which contains the pip/setuptools/wheel versions that
virtualenv shipped with. This was done to prevent any
leaking of the wrong version into the virtualenv and was
the only way of doing it with much earlier versions of
virtualenv.

We can now update the method of achieving the same goal
without breaking the virtualenv tooling, which this patch
does.

The virtualenv_support folder missing is causing the
repo-server role which uses virtualenv to fail in upgrades
to queens. That role needs a complete and properly working
version of virtualenv in place.

Change-Id: I2c50bb693dc5dc505bddce34ff45294ac44f7dc9
Closes-Bug: #1746935

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/523958/11/ : SUCCESS in 3h 23m 34s'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2018-01-16 18:15:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

(4 comments)

As discussed on IRC, looks like this breaks live migration in both the host->native (upgrade) case, and native->native case. The issue is that we're generating destination xml on the source host.

In the native->native case this means we're generating xml with the secret uuid from the source host, not the destination host. Don't know if it's possible, but we could fix this by specifying the secret uuid explicitly when creating it so it's the same on source and dest.

In the host->native (upgrade) case we're generating destination xml without encryptor information, but when we call _connect_volume on the destination we will generate a new host secret and not attach the encryptor. I think this will result in the raw encrypted volume being presented to the guest.

Incidentally, I was going to suggest that failing the latter case would be acceptable as the problem goes away once the upgrade is complete across the deployment. However, that would require deployers to do in-place upgrades, which seems overly restrictive. I suspect we need to fix this too."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2018-01-17 10:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2018-01-17 10:30:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:
