subject: add column 'host' container belongs to when 'zun list'
messages:
[{'account_id': 27701, 'date': '2018-02-01 11:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-01 16:02:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi @WangChangyu,

The 'host' field is displayed at "zun show". With this in mind, do we really need to add this field to "zun list"? What are the enabled use cases? Also, note that 'host' is an admin-only field [1]. That means this field is missing for non-admin users so I am not sure if it is a good idea to add it.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/zun/commit/587a3d2407597ffb458f79d60540ae6e474b6f98#diff-6b6a6cf666de1c88c4b17b4f1586d9ed'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2018-02-02 04:42:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hi Wang, I also think it is not correct to show host in non-admin APIs. Nova also has the same behavior.'}, {'account_id': 27701, 'date': '2018-02-02 07:12:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add resize test for multiattach volumes

This adds a test to create a multiattach volume and attach
it to two servers, then resizes those servers and detaches
the volume from each server.

Depends-On: Id7760cdfb9874014e03c7d8ebe269a03562bde18

Change-Id: Icd7dbcfe9b62df5311053e2da073c7a5546da319

Logging once per instance per periodic task run that nothing was done,
because it is already correct, is unnecessary.

Fix the wording of the debug messages, to be correct after future
releases and account for the ironic driver requesting the same
behaviour.

Closes-Bug: 1719714
Change-Id: Id68b68c261efbe4f18d2fb15cb08240866e22466
(cherry picked from commit 895e3be3fee74bf71a80e9ccad482fdd408fa42f)
'}]
commit_message:
Only log not correcting allocation once per period

Logging once per instance per periodic task run that nothing was done,
because it is already correct, is unnecessary.

Fix the wording of the debug messages, to be correct after future
releases and account for the ironic driver requesting the same
behaviour.

Closes-Bug: 1719714
Change-Id: Id68b68c261efbe4f18d2fb15cb08240866e22466
(cherry picked from commit 895e3be3fee74bf71a80e9ccad482fdd408fa42f)

subject: Refactor expirer unit tests
messages:
[{'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-01-25 10:51:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-01-25 10:58:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-01-29 09:06:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

At first, I like this approach but I'm feeling some points to discuss are remaining so set my -1. 

1. thinking of that we should touch around expierer injections at once in the patch. sort of setting failure method directly without patching

2. minor refactor in the FakeInternalClient at [1]

3. Assertion changes (But it's from inconsistent testing env in the original code)

Perhaps, they are things like just 'let's do them in the latter follow up' though. Anyway, waiting Kazuhiro's ack.

1: https://gist.github.com/bloodeagle40234/742de8dab015298dac25ef5d159e4072"}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-01-30 05:21:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-01-30 05:28:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(4 comments)

I reflected kota's comments.

> 1. thinking of that we should touch around expierer injections at once in the patch. sort of setting failure method directly without patching

I updated implementation to use mock patches.

> 2. minor refactor in the FakeInternalClient at [1]

Kota, thank you for your refactoring. I updated FakeInternalClient.

> 3. Assertion changes (But it's from inconsistent testing env in the original code)

I restored original assertions. Now, I think the inconsistency can be accepted, because the inconsistency can happen in actual swift cluster."}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-01-30 07:18:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Now, I think the inconsistency can be accepted, because the inconsistency can happen in actual swift cluster.

Sorry, this is misleading. I think the inconsistency can be accepted in this patch, but I will discuss and update the behavior in another patch.
The change will be required for general task queue patch. Because expirer's behavior for general task queue is that it checks ALL OF TASK ACCOUNTS which has more than one task objects.
It means that unit tests for expirer will have long log line checking.

After this patch merged, I will push a patch for the change."}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-01-31 08:24:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-01-31 08:28:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-01-31 08:41:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

(4 comments)

LGTM. The newer FakeInternalClient looks better than the older local definitions.'}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-01-31 10:09:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-02-02 04:18:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Nice refactor and cleanup Kazuhiro!'}]

[{'created': '2018-01-25 10:51:18.000000000', 'message': "Refactor expirer unit tests

In expirer's unit tests, fake InternalClient classes are defined
and its instance simulates expirer's task queue behaviors.

To make review for expirer's task queue update patch [1] easy,
this patch refactors the implementation of the fake InternalClient
classes. In this patch, unit tests are refactored by the following
two approaches:
    #1: Summarizing duplicated fake InternalClient implementation
    #2: Make task account name variable
The #2 approach is for multiple task accounts in [1].

The patch [1] will be rebased after this patch merged.

commit_message:
Refactor expirer unit tests

In expirer's unit tests, fake InternalClient classes are defined
and its instance simulates expirer's task queue behaviors.

To make review for expirer's task queue update patch [1] easy,
this patch refactors the implementation of the fake InternalClient
classes. In this patch, unit tests are refactored by the following
two approaches:
    #1: Summarizing duplicated fake InternalClient implementation
    #2: Make task account name variable
The #2 approach is for multiple task accounts in [1].

The patch [1] will be rebased after this patch merged.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517389

Change-Id: I10a7151cfdd43460ad38c47f672d3c31b77e7990

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-10 23:42:55.000000000', 'message': "Fix instance lookup in hide_server_addresses extension

The hide_server_addresses extension is looking up the cached
instance based on what the user provided for the server id,
which may not match what is used to cache the instance for the
request. For example, a request with upper-case server uuid
could be found in a mysql-backed system because mysql is
case insensitive by default, but the instance is keyed off the
server id from the DB, which is lower-case, so we'll fail
to look up the instance in the cache if the IDs don't match.

There is no test for this because it turns out it's actually
really hard to recreate this since it requires running with a
mysql backend to recreate the case insensitive check, which
isn't going to work with sqlite. Given how trivial this fix is,
creating a big mysql recreate test is not worth it.

Change-Id: I09b288aa2ad9969800a3cd26c675b002c6c9f638
Closes-Bug: #1693335
(cherry picked from commit ecfb65cee68e96cc99ceecddbf27c6d6f768358e)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix instance lookup in hide_server_addresses extension

The hide_server_addresses extension is looking up the cached
instance based on what the user provided for the server id,
which may not match what is used to cache the instance for the
request. For example, a request with upper-case server uuid
could be found in a mysql-backed system because mysql is
case insensitive by default, but the instance is keyed off the
server id from the DB, which is lower-case, so we'll fail
to look up the instance in the cache if the IDs don't match.

There is no test for this because it turns out it's actually
really hard to recreate this since it requires running with a
mysql backend to recreate the case insensitive check, which
isn't going to work with sqlite. Given how trivial this fix is,
creating a big mysql recreate test is not worth it.

Change-Id: I09b288aa2ad9969800a3cd26c675b002c6c9f638
Closes-Bug: #1693335
(cherry picked from commit ecfb65cee68e96cc99ceecddbf27c6d6f768358e)

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I897b82a12198ab951ebad99e3bdf59314ec4e936

commit_message:
Limit the amount of disk of container

The patch supports the storage_opt size=xxx when run/create
a container. If user set this option, it can limit the size
of the hard disk per container.

Change-Id: Iafcf9d1a4a2b7ccb70998d8797eada29ed3315f5
Implements: blueprint limit-container-diskspace

[{'created': '2018-01-26 01:33:58.000000000', 'message': "Log the events we timed out waiting for while plugging vifs

We currently log that we timed out waiting for vif plugging callbacks
from neutron but we don't include detail about which vif_ids we were
waiting for. This adds the event_names to the log message to aid
in debugging.

Related-Bug: #1744361

Change-Id: I8b67f1049b6a968b1dd0d839a7f0b30aa1730eeb
"}]
commit_message:
Log the events we timed out waiting for while plugging vifs

We currently log that we timed out waiting for vif plugging callbacks
from neutron but we don't include detail about which vif_ids we were
waiting for. This adds the event_names to the log message to aid
in debugging.

Related-Bug: #1744361

Change-Id: I8b67f1049b6a968b1dd0d839a7f0b30aa1730eeb

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10608, 'name': 'Matthew Edmonds', 'email': 'edmondsw@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'edmondsw'}, {'_account_id': 14384, 'name': 'Quobyte CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci-external@quobyte.com', 'username': 'quobyteci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23498, 'name': 'IBM zVM CI', 'email': 'zvmosci@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'zvmosci'}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-01-24 18:24:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-01-24 18:46:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

FWIW - I would still merge this patch just to keep testing policy somewhat consistent with policies in the real world. But it does feel like this could be refactor since defaults are in code now.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-24 18:48:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-01-24 18:56:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)

One thing I noticed this release was that this practice isn't uncommon across projects that aren't keystone. Nova just wants to test an API but doesn't want to get hung-up checking the token (or fake token/context from the request) has the right roles to pass the policy, which most of the time requires "admin" or some other role/rule that isn't an empty string. By replacing all policies with empty strings, nova tests don't have to be dependent on setting up proper RBAC infrastructure just for a unit test to pass, which is where the "" bits come it.

The other pattern I noticed was that some projects write a fixture or mock to always return true when calling enforce or its wrapper, authorize [0]. Which means you can call the API, including the oslo.policy enforcement, without having to maintain a list of empty and fake policies just to get tests to run, but at the same time you don't have to worry about deploying full RBAC for nova unit tests.

Hopefully this helps...

[0] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.policy/blob/master/oslo_policy/policy.py#L779'}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-01-24 19:22:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

just because these are deprecated doesn't mean we should stop testing them. And if we do want to stop testing them, probably need to remove them from test_policy.py as well to match. E.g. https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/tests/unit/test_policy.py#L420"}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-01-25 02:53:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/537600/1/ : FAILURE in 3h 10m 45s'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-01-26 19:58:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-12909 : SUCCESS in 1h 46m 18s'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-01-26 22:34:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So this one takes care of the deprecation warnings in unit tests and the changed stacked on top of this one takes care of the deprecation warnings in functional tests?'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-01-26 22:42:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

> just because these are deprecated doesn't mean we should stop
 > testing them. And if we do want to stop testing them, probably need
 > to remove them from test_policy.py as well to match. E.g.
 > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/tests/unit/test_policy.py#L420

Unless I'm missing something, it seems like it makes sense to keep them tested in test_policy.py (which tests that the rules work properly when authorize is called on them). Otherwise, for the rest of our unit tests, we don't need to try and import deprecated policy rules, so remove them from the fake_policy used in the PolicyFixture."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-26 22:54:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-01-26 23:30:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> So this one takes care of the deprecation warnings in unit tests
 > and the changed stacked on top of this one takes care of the
 > deprecation warnings in functional tests?

Without knowing a ton about the functional testing infrastructure in nova, I'm not entirely sure. Both patches remove the deprecation warnings for tests setting up this policy fixture, but for different reasons. What Dan's proposed is likely an exercise that will need to be done periodically as policy changes come and go (and if they are included in the fixture). The subsequent patch ensures we don't bother writing a deprecated policy to disk, which would trigger the same deprecation warning. Oslo.policy is just ensuring we emit _something_ to operators if it detects a possible overridden policy on disk.

Technically you shouldn't see warnings if you run the tests with only the second patch in this chain, but +1 for keeping test policies up-to-date."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-01-27 00:02:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-01-27 00:04:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1

Just swapped the ordering of the two policy deprecation patches in case the one that affects functional tests will reduce job timeouts in the gate and alleviate things. Re-approving.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-01-27 11:33:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/537600/2/ : FAILURE in 5h 03m 11s'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-01-27 12:35:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-13030 : SUCCESS in 1h 59m 32s'}]

Remove deprecated policy items from fake_policy

These were causing a lot of warnings during test runs because they are
deprecated and should be removed.

Change-Id: I3ea3f364bfbd201c72354cdd4e410f08ff5225c5

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I2f72ee6dfccef10ddc5288e48ce96704f2f2c295

commit_message:
Run cinder-backup in a privileged container

The cinder-backup service requires privileges in order to make iSCSI
connections.

Closes-Bug: 1745628
Change-Id: I63423ac4715269163e36d59d2703502455d33f86
(cherry picked from commit 0c65801ac9ea8b12d670a05ace85a96cb8828b22)

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I45531a8827d1fc8d624c1e7a73e1d7df0ca2a0a2

When backing up a snapshot or 'in-use' volume,
cinder creates a temp volume from the snapshot
or 'in-use' volume, then backup the temp volume.
The temp volume doesn't use the volume-quota,
but deleting the temp volume when finishing
backup will minus quota. This process leads to
a wrong quota-usage. So when deleting a temp
volume, skip handling quota.

commit_message:
Fix cinder quota-usage error

When backing up a snapshot or 'in-use' volume,
cinder creates a temp volume from the snapshot
or 'in-use' volume, then backup the temp volume.
The temp volume doesn't use the volume-quota,
but deleting the temp volume when finishing
backup will minus quota. This process leads to
a wrong quota-usage. So add admin volume metadata
when creating the temporary volume and then use
that data to detect temporary volume. Then skip
handling quota when deleting the temp volume.

Change-Id: If100a678cf9062c4078f850d8edc001b6b0705f4
Closes-Bug: #1670636

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Fix: request-id missing in volume action's response header.

Several volume actions use webob.Response object to
return HTTP codes and cinder's wsgi layer doesn't append
request-id if the actions return webob.Response object.

If we intend to return certain HTTP code, we should use
wsgi.response decorator and let cinder's wsgi layer create
response object of it's own.

Change-Id: Ibd6f60301e73022fecae4286e68d152bab73a40e
Closes-Bug: 1743404

commit_message:
Storwize: correct return value for update_group

Adding volumes to replication group is done one by one. If one
volume adding fails, the group status will be updated to error.
Those volumes which are added successfully to the replication
group in the backend should also be updated and the
related group id should be filled.

Closes-Bug: 1745552

Part of blueprint request-traits-in-nova

commit_message:
Add functional tests for traits-based scheduling

This adds a couple of functional tests for the end-to-end
flow of creating a server with a flavor that has a required
trait. Each test has two computes. One test covers the case
of a successful placement on a compute that has a trait where
the other compute doesn't. The other test covers the case that
none of the computes have the required trait so the server
create request fails.

Part of blueprint request-traits-in-nova

Change-Id: Iacb9808ef7188e3419abfac9e8c5fb5a46c71c05

commit_message:
Delete base module not applicable definition.

In base module execute functional has exist repeat definition.
result and result_err use proc.communicate() value, the result
and result_err value '' out of use.

Change-Id: I1e1fc208b30f8bb367171e42cf688255fd9864f9
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded version in DB2 install path

The DB2 path needs to be changed to something
basic and not using a version number because we
don't want to update the code every time than a
new DB2 version is released.

Updated DB2 version from 10.5 to 11.1, version
10.5 is no more available on IBM website.

Closes-Bug: #1746351
Change-Id: I4fd7c66c3cd5ff8d540e994ada979b59c7def35e

Change-Id: I8c1a735c52054b545524f809cbc35d7a7a39a645
Signed-off-by: Rishabh Dave <ridave@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-01-31 07:09:39.000000000', 'message': "drivers/cephfs: log an error if RO access is used and it's unavailable

Read-only (RO) access was introduced in Ceph version 10.2.3 (Jewel). If
RO access is being used on a lower version, (also) log an error in
response.

Change-Id: I8c1a735c52054b545524f809cbc35d7a7a39a645
Signed-off-by: Rishabh Dave <ridave@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
drivers/cephfs: log an error if RO access is used and it's unavailable

Read-only (RO) access was introduced in Ceph version 10.2.3 (Jewel). If
RO access is being used on a lower version, (also) log an error in
response.

Change-Id: I8c1a735c52054b545524f809cbc35d7a7a39a645
Signed-off-by: Rishabh Dave <ridave@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove unavailable exception catch when get_subcommand_parser

there will never be KeyError exception raised
when get subcommand module in func get_subcommand_parser

Change-Id: Ibab151a4cf035af286f2e17985dd9b862210b80d

commit_message:
Delete the capsule and container when request volume build failed

If the request volume build failed, we need to delete the capsule
and containers inside capsule from the database. Or it will remain
a capsule without any realization.

Closes-Bug: #1746427

Change-Id: I778c457755f72804b852de77fb151e8e0fdead6a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@arm.com>

commit_message:
XenAPI: support ceilometer service

This to support configuration on ceilometer services for XenAPI.
1. set hypervisor_inspector as xenapi
2. Confiugre the section of [xenapi] for XenAPI connection

For details, please refer to the config doc:
https://docs.openstack.org/ceilometer/latest/configuration/index.html

Change-Id: I4fc649d927031886c694507b3e8a686646a61ef7
blueprint: xenserver-support

subject: Use oslo log replace 'import logging'
messages:
[{'account_id': 21690, 'date': '2018-02-01 10:32:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21690, 'date': '2018-02-01 10:48:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 25167, 'date': '2018-02-02 02:11:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27577, 'date': '2018-02-02 02:16:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Need unit testing to make sure your modify is usable.'}, {'account_id': 27577, 'date': '2018-02-02 02:16:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

Others LGTM'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-02-02 03:40:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I do understand the intent to converge to Oslo libraries. However, I don't get the points for command line utils to use the Oslo.log library. A user for the most of his life will want the logs or errors dumped directly to the stdout instead of being marshaled this way and that way and/or redirected to a log file.
So ... I really want to know what the benefits this change is bringing us?"}, {'account_id': 21690, 'date': '2018-02-02 03:50:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I do understand the intent to converge to Oslo libraries. However,
 > I don't get the points for command line utils to use the Oslo.log
 > library. A user for the most of his life will want the logs or
 > errors dumped directly to the stdout instead of being marshaled
 > this way and that way and/or redirected to a log file.
 > So ... I really want to know what the benefits this change is
 > bringing us?

This change is not necessary if the log or error is directly dumped to the standard output."}, {'account_id': 21690, 'date': '2018-02-02 03:50:54.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-11 22:11:25.000000000', 'message': "Add notification for floatingip delete

As neutron now allows L3 Flavors, but when other backends use L3
flavors, the floating delete only commits db transaction therefore
removing fip from neutron db but backend still have that fip as active
because there's no notification for the subscribed precommit_delete
event.

Change-Id: I87dd124cc5bf17365ca197e4b35ffaa7825ca17c
Closes-Bug: #1742802
"}, {'created': '2018-01-12 00:46:37.000000000', 'message': "Add notification for floatingip delete

As neutron now allows L3 Flavors, but when other backends use L3
flavors, the floating delete only commits db transaction therefore
removing fip from neutron db but backend still have that fip as active
because there's no notification for the subscribed precommit_delete
event.

Change-Id: I87dd124cc5bf17365ca197e4b35ffaa7825ca17c
Closes-Bug: #1742802

commit_message:
Add notification for floatingip update/delete

As neutron now allows L3 Flavors, but when other backends use L3
flavors, the floating delete only commits db transaction therefore
removing fip from neutron db but backend still have that fip as active
because there's no notification for the subscribed precommit_delete
event.

Co-Authored-By: Isaku Yamahata <isaku.yamahata@intel.com>
Change-Id: I87dd124cc5bf17365ca197e4b35ffaa7825ca17c
Closes-Bug: #1742802

commit_message:
tempest: set compute-feature-enabled.volume_multiattach

This adds the ENABLE_VOLUME_MULTIATTACH flag and if True
configures Tempest to run volume multiattach tests.

Note that due to https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1378242
we can't run multiattach tests with the Pike UCA packages since
those include qemu 2.10 and libvirt 3.6, and the valid versions for
multiattach support with libvirt is qemu<2.10 or libvirt>=3.10.

Depends-On: I80c20914c03d7371e798ca3567c37307a0d54aaa
Depends-On: I158c6f20e3e6a24bd2e5299abbeb3fc5208e5885

Part of nova blueprint multi-attach-volume

Change-Id: I46b7eabf6a28f230666f6933a087f73cb4408348

commit_message:
Add scope_types for user policies

This commit adds the scope types for all user policies. This is the
first step towards making keystone APIs more flexible for project or
domain administrators. It should also result in more security because
enforcing scope will ensure proper scoped-RBAC enforcement.

Change-Id: I5ddde56e8dcc85b7c98af3207af0e81fd64b2514

There are two ways of booting VM on AArch64 architecture:

1. UEFI
2. kernel+initrd

for every image. Otherwise they simply hang. So let's set is as default
if no other value for hw_firmware_type is set.

(cherry picked from commit 6f54f5c1e37a42b395ca793f869b73aa902602ed)

commit_message:
Use UEFI as the default boot for AArch64

There are two ways of booting VM on AArch64 architecture:

1. UEFI
2. kernel+initrd

No one sane goes for 2nd option so hw_firmware_type=uefi has to be set
for every image. Otherwise they simply hang. So let's set is as default
if no other value for hw_firmware_type is set.

If someone will implement own way then they can set hw_firmware_type to
own value and add support to Nova.

Closes-Bug: #1740824

Co-authored-by: Kevin Zhao <Kevin.Zhao@arm.com>
Change-Id: I70ad5ecb420b7d469854e8743e38ba27fd204747
(cherry picked from commit 6f54f5c1e37a42b395ca793f869b73aa902602ed)

* Link to the BDM docs for more details about BDM parameter values.

  that were available in nova.

commit_message:
Cleanup launch instance and manage IPs docs

This is a follow up to Ie039322660fd0e2e0403843448379b78114c425b.

A few things are changed here:

* The note about using file injection is removed. File injection
  was deprecated in the API in Queens and not something that we
  really want users using.
* Mention that creating a flavor is typically admin-only.
* Link to the BDM docs for more details about BDM parameter values.
* Update the manage-ip-address docs to make the examples rely on
  using the networking resource CLIs rather than any proxy APIs
  that were available in nova.

Change-Id: Ifa2e2bbb4c5f51f13d1a5832bd7dbf9f690fcad7

commit_message:
Migrate "launch instance" user guide docs

This imports the "launch instance" end user guide docs from
the openstack-manuals repo. As part of the docs migration
in Pike, these were forgotten. The copied contents come from
the stable/ocata branch of openstack-manuals, and therefore
likely need some updating, but that could be done in follow up
changes. This is an initial import to (1) publish the content
again somewhere and (2) fix broken links in the cinder docs
for booting from volume.

Change-Id: Ie039322660fd0e2e0403843448379b78114c425b
Partial-Bug: #1714017
Related-Bug: #1711267

Before I have already read https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v2/#create-volume,I know the bootable can't be set in request.
At first I think we should update volume bootable status.
But later,I try in my environment,if we create a volume which not contain image,the bootable status is false,if we create a volume which contain image,the bootable status is true.
Also you can check tempest/scenario/test_volume_boot_pattern.py(it don't updates volume bootable status )
def _create_volume_from_image(self):
    img_uuid = CONF.compute.image_ref
    vol_name = data_utils.rand_name(
        self.__class__.__name__ + '-volume-origin')
    return self.create_volume(name=vol_name, imageRef=img_uuid)
	
# create an instance from volume
    LOG.info("Booting instance 1 from volume")
    volume_origin = self._create_volume_from_image()
    instance_1st = self._boot_instance_from_resource(
        source_id=volume_origin['id'],
        source_type='volume',
        keypair=keypair,
        security_group=security_group)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-10 18:55:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-01-12 22:48:46.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add a test for cinder multiattach

This adds a compute API test for testing a multiattach volume in
Cinder being attached to multiple instances in Nova and then
detaching them.

Follow on tests will test the boot from volume case with multiattach.

TODO(mriedem): need to add a devstack change that depends on this
change which sets the compute-feature-enabled.volume_multiattach
flag to True (for the libvirt driver).

Depends-On: Ib78fcd7c54c966dcbc143165a262e582bbda0901

Part of blueprint multi-attach-volume

Change-Id: I80c20914c03d7371e798ca3567c37307a0d54aaa
'}, {'created': '2016-01-13 02:42:54.000000000', 'message': "Add a test for cinder multiattach

This adds a compute API test for testing a multiattach volume in
Cinder being attached to multiple instances in Nova and then
detaching them.

Follow on tests will test the boot from volume case with multiattach.

This change depends on the nova series that adds the support to nova's
libvirt driver.

Devstack change I46b7eabf6a28f230666f6933a087f73cb4408348 is used to
enable this test when using the libvirt driver.

commit_message:
Add a few tests for cinder multiattach

This adds basic compute API tests for testing a multiattach volume in
Cinder being attached to multiple instances in Nova and then
detaching them.

This change depends on the nova series that adds the support to nova's
libvirt driver.

Devstack change I46b7eabf6a28f230666f6933a087f73cb4408348 is used to
enable this test when using the libvirt driver.

Depends-On: I02120ef8767c3f9c9497bff67101e57e204ed6f4
Depends-On: Iac67f112b0dc9353c6a66e6fbc81cc8324a2b37c

Part of nova blueprint multi-attach-volume

Change-Id: I80c20914c03d7371e798ca3567c37307a0d54aaa

commit_message:
ffu: Introduce ffu upgrade tasks

This change introduces the steps used for upgrading a Newton env
to Queens by following the fast forward upgrade steps.

Co-Authored-By: Marius Cornea <mcornea@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7a1478edc4a55a64960c136490019f202439b8dc

commit_message:
Load undercloud DB password to a mistral environment

This patch adds a new variable to the mistral
environment 'tripleo.undercloud-config' allowing
to retrieve the root password for the MySQL
databases. Now this variable can be accessed from any
Mistral workflow.
Also, this patch adds the ability of checking if
the variables are not loaded properly due to
an upgrade, in that case we update the Mistral
environment to have all the variables in place.

(cherry picked from commit be3bd48214e6719db9bd364f020ea5b652b9a536)

commit_message:
Migrate the remaining classic drivers to hardware types

I've tried my best to provide a correct matching for these, but
there are two exceptions:

* fake_drac uses iscsi deploy with None boot, which cannot work,
  so changing both to fake
* some fake drivers are migrated to the 'fake' power interface,
  which is changed to include soft power as well.

The latter means that all fake classic drivers now support fake
soft power actions, while previously only fake_soft_power did.
Now fake_soft_power is identical to fake and is left for backward
compatibility

Also wrote more tests to check correctness of this migration.

Change-Id: I00c9c6ed698b10f035e65428e1a20d733c7e544a
Partial-Bug: #1690185

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I34872b5c9a2ed82a8dd1e7112453c0d99cb5e0ba

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-24 17:30:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix how backups handle encryption key IDs

As described in the launchpad bug [1], backup operations must take care
to ensure encryption key ID resources aren't lost, and that restored
volumes always have a unique encryption key ID.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1745180

This patch adds an 'encryption_key_id' column to the backups table. Now,
when a backup is created and the source volume's encryption key is
cloned, the cloned key ID is stored in the table. This makes it possible
to delete the cloned key ID when the backup is deleted. The code that
clones the volume's encryption key has been relocated from the common
backup driver layer to the backup manager. The backup manager now has
full responsibility for managing encryption key IDs.

When restoring a backup of an encrypted volume, the backup manager now
does this:
1) If the restored volume's encryption key ID has changed, delete the
   key ID it had prior to the restore operation. This ensures no key IDs
   are leaked.
2) If the 'encryption_key_id' field in the backup table is empty, glean
   the backup's cloned key ID from the backup's "volume base metadata."
   This helps populate the 'encryption_key_id' column for backup table
   entries created prior to when the column existed.
3) Re-clone the backup's key ID to ensure the restored volume's key ID
   is always unique.

Closes-Bug: #1745180
Change-Id: I6cadcbf839d146b2fd57d7019f73dce303f9e10b

commit_message:
Fix how backups handle encryption key IDs

As described in the launchpad bug [1], backup operations must take care
to ensure encryption key ID resources aren't lost, and that restored
volumes always have a unique encryption key ID.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1745180

This patch adds an 'encryption_key_id' column to the backups table. Now,
when a backup is created and the source volume's encryption key is
cloned, the cloned key ID is stored in the table. This makes it possible
to delete the cloned key ID when the backup is deleted. The code that
clones the volume's encryption key has been relocated from the common
backup driver layer to the backup manager. The backup manager now has
full responsibility for managing encryption key IDs.

When restoring a backup of an encrypted volume, the backup manager now
does this:
1) If the restored volume's encryption key ID has changed, delete the
   key ID it had prior to the restore operation. This ensures no key IDs
   are leaked.
2) If the 'encryption_key_id' field in the backup table is empty, glean
   the backup's cloned key ID from the backup's "volume base metadata."
   This helps populate the 'encryption_key_id' column for backup table
   entries created prior to when the column existed.
3) Re-clone the backup's key ID to ensure the restored volume's key ID
   is always unique.

Closes-Bug: #1745180
Change-Id: I6cadcbf839d146b2fd57d7019f73dce303f9e10b

For this kind of system level actions, I'm afraid that once we open "enforce_scope", all related test will fail since we now don't test them with system-scoped token in the test code. is there any road map?'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-01-29 14:49:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> For this kind of system level actions, I'm afraid that once we open

 > them with system-scoped token in the test code. is there any road
 > map?

You're right. The enforce_scope option from oslo.policy can't be set to true until we have that infrastructure in place. We need to make sure we setup a system administrator account in keystone test cases, then start using that in places where system-level calls are required.

commit_message:
Add scope_types to mapping policies

The mapping API is intended to work with both `project` and `system`
scopes. It should be possible for system administrators to add
mappings for federation. It should also be possible for project or
domain administrators to add mappings for IdP authenticating to their
domain.

The scope types for managing mappings has been set to `system` until
that functionality is supported in keystone.

From now on, a warning will be logged when a project-scoped token is
used to manage federated mappings. Operators will have the ability to
require system-scoped tokens for these policies by enabling
oslo.policy's `enforce_scope` configuration option.

Change-Id: I6208ce23b77bb1db4896263369f6b2207b6e10ab

commit_message:
Add scope_types for policy policies

This commit adds `system` to the list of scope types for all policy
policies. Policies aren't really used and should be considered
system-level until authorization can be done without having to modify
service policy files.

From now on, a warning will be logged when a project-scoped token is
used for policy management. Operators can opt into requiring
system-scoped tokens for these policies by enabling oslo.policy's
`enforce_scope` configuration option.

Change-Id: I1542a78f66817ac9b36ec26c308aca08e3c23af7

subject: Document scope_types for credential policies
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 10420, 'name': 'Adrian Turjak', 'email': 'devs+openstack@uncaught-exceptions.com', 'username': 'adriant'}, {'_account_id': 21420, 'name': 'Gage Hugo', 'email': 'gagehugo@gmail.com', 'username': 'ghugo'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26201, 'name': 'AT&T Openstack-Helm CI', 'email': 'stacey.fletcher@att.com', 'username': 'ATT-OSH-CI'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-12-06 20:56:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-12-06 20:57:34.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to add-scope-types'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2017-12-06 22:58:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Scope with credentials is a little weird, since... the credential model CAN be linked to a project:
https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/credential/backends/sql.py#L29

And in fact that is used for the EC2 credentials, since those are project specific.

TOTP credentials (and some of the custom credential types I've been playing with) are user bound, so the project_id field is unset. 

But beyond that I've been thinking about project related MFA credentials such that a user must use a specific auth method/credential when authenticating to a specific project, but that's not terribly important. The idea there being, if you have a TOTP credential (or other MFA) set with a project_id, if you are authenticating to that project, it first checks if you have any project specific credentials before looking at non-project specific ones.

Ultimately credentials are user owned, but potentially project related. So project scope doesn't entirely really matter with the direct credentials API, but the EC2 api does care about the scope.

This means that in reality interacting with the credentials API may not even really need a scoped token, unless you are setting the project_id, at which point the id you are setting should match the scope you have.

If you are a system scoped admin user, they should just do whatever."}, {'account_id': 26201, 'date': '2017-12-06 23:31:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build Started http://10.24.20.18:30081/job/images/job/openstack/job/loci/job/keystone/20/'}, {'account_id': 26201, 'date': '2017-12-06 23:39:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

This is a hard one but I don't think it's appropriate to set 'system' scope on these."}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-01-19 19:26:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This change adds scope types for all credential policies and sets it
to `system`. When keystone supports the ability to enforce credential
checks in code based on the system-scoped tokens versus
project-scoped tokens, we should consider adding `project` to the
list of scope types for credential policies.

From now on, a warning will be logged when a project-scoped token is
used to manage credentials. Operators can opt into requiring

Change-Id: I61b15f3b2865e516a5358b9caacdb7ca8f6f1d17

to `system` and `project`, but leaves them commented out. When
keystone supports the ability to enforce credential checks in code
based on the system-scoped tokens versus project-scoped tokens, we
can uncomment the scope_types and allow them to be enforced.

This commit describes how those API should behave in different

Change-Id: I61b15f3b2865e516a5358b9caacdb7ca8f6f1d17

commit_message:
Document scope_types for credential policies

This change adds scope types for all credential policies and sets it
to `system` and `project`, but leaves them commented out. When
keystone supports the ability to enforce credential checks in code
based on the system-scoped tokens versus project-scoped tokens, we
can uncomment the scope_types and allow them to be enforced.

This commit describes how those API should behave in different
circumstances and gives us something track using bugs.

commit_message:
Add server filters whitelist in server api-ref

We maintain the whitelist for valid server filters key
but have not documented those clearly.

This patch adds whitelist for non-admin and admin users.

Change-Id: Idc031916c804a18876551113a0fd57d4a463cd63

commit_message:
Move zuul_copy_output to be a job variable

The zuul_copy_output variable is designed to be able to be used as
a zuul job variable so that zuul dictionary merging will work. However,
it's currently being set in the playbook rather than as a job variable,
so it's not possible to supplement it in a child job.

Move it to be a job variable. Also remove the wrapping {} as they should
not be needed to make zuul_copy_output a dictionary.

Change-Id: I78c7fed47c2ab868384c74dbff7904d33d510dd9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-25 21:07:00.000000000', 'message': 'More efficiently clean up OVS ports

Previously, running neutron_ovs_cleanup on an installation with
5000 ports would time out even after setting the timeout to 3
hours. The code would do a bridge and port "by name" lookup for
every port due to being based off the ovs-vsctl implementation
where names are how everything is looked up. With this change,
the same test runs in ~1.5 mins.

This implementation adds a new OVSDB command that just looks up
the bridge, iterates over its ports, and deletes the ones that
should be deleted in a single transaction per bridge.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/ovsdb/impl_idl.py
	neutron/cmd/ovs_cleanup.py
	neutron/tests/unit/cmd/test_ovs_cleanup.py

Change-Id: I23c81813654596d61d8d930e0bfb0f016f91bc46
(cherry picked from commit fef374131b5df33ab0e5516ba3f03c90089726dc)
'}, {'created': '2018-01-29 14:18:42.000000000', 'message': 'More efficiently clean up OVS ports

5000 ports would time out even after setting the timeout to 3
hours. The code would do a bridge and port "by name" lookup for
every port due to being based off the ovs-vsctl implementation

	neutron/cmd/ovs_cleanup.py

commit_message:
More efficiently clean up OVS ports

Previously, running neutron_ovs_cleanup on an installation with
5000 ports would time out even after setting the timeout to 3
hours. The code would do a bridge and port "by name" lookup for
every port due to being based off the ovs-vsctl implementation
where names are how everything is looked up. With this change,
the same test runs in ~1.5 mins.

This implementation adds a new OVSDB command that just looks up
the bridge, iterates over its ports, and deletes the ones that
should be deleted in a single transaction per bridge.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/ovsdb/impl_idl.py
	neutron/cmd/ovs_cleanup.py
	neutron/tests/unit/cmd/test_ovs_cleanup.py

Change-Id: I23c81813654596d61d8d930e0bfb0f016f91bc46
(cherry picked from commit fef374131b5df33ab0e5516ba3f03c90089726dc)

This causes a warning to be issued for every RBD test.

Modify fake_volume_obj() to prevent this.

Change-Id: Ib2fff5af7ae7dc8663b15832e39080fe0a51e71d
'}]
commit_message:
Tests: Fix RBD invalid UUID warnings

This causes a warning to be issued for every RBD test.

Modify fake_volume_obj() to prevent this.

Change-Id: Ib2fff5af7ae7dc8663b15832e39080fe0a51e71d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-01 14:18:30.000000000', 'message': 'Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I2604716833cb0b1ac64facf3ae09236ad7d56fb9
'}]
commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I2604716833cb0b1ac64facf3ae09236ad7d56fb9

commit_message:
V3 jsonschema validation: volume_type_access

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below volume type access
API's:
* Add private volume type access to project
  POST /v3/{project_id}/types/{volume_type}/action

* Remove private volume type access from project
  POST /v3/{project_id}/types/{volume_type}/action

Made changes to unit tests to pass body as keyword argument as wsgi
calls action method [1] and passes body as keyword argument.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/api/openstack/wsgi.py#L997

Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

Change-Id: I5d5a58b7ce3615c8c4cbaa622c0691de38c88969

commit_message:
P->M upgrade we need pike containers, not the ones from master.

When deploying the overcloud, we get the containers from
master(queens).  This makes the pike overcloud deployment fails.

Add the creation of all the required tags and adjust.

Closes-Bug: #1745348
Change-Id: I468e14d746fd5ab5a51485ee9b907efc44391c56

i don't understand the reason for the difference in this patch from the master version, and the bug does not explain it either.

why delete the additional plugins in pike?"}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2017-09-29 10:34:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> i don't understand the reason for the difference in this patch from
 > the master version, and the bug does not explain it either.
 > 
 > why delete the additional plugins in pike?

Hi James,
This environment file configures networking-bgpvpn with OpenDaylight as service_provider. Let me explain the old version: 
  NeutronServicePlugins: 'router, networking_bgpvpn.neutron.services.plugin.BGPVPNPlugin'

router is not the right L3 configuration for OpenDaylight, this is for just regular OVS setup based on agents. The correct service_plugin should be odl_router_v2. Stevedore aliases are supported in networking-bgpvpn, so that's why we change from:

networking_bgpvpn.neutron.services.plugin.BGPVPNPlugin

to:

bgpvpn

And finally, we also add trunk, because it's also included in all the OpenDaylight environment files:

https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/pike/environments/neutron-opendaylight.yaml
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/pike/environments/neutron-opendaylight-dpdk.yaml"}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2017-09-29 11:28:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > i don't understand the reason for the difference in this patch
 > from
 > > the master version, and the bug does not explain it either.
 > >
 > > why delete the additional plugins in pike?
 > 
 > Hi James,
 > This environment file configures networking-bgpvpn with
 > OpenDaylight as service_provider. Let me explain the old version:
 > NeutronServicePlugins: 'router, networking_bgpvpn.neutron.services.plugin.BGPVPNPlugin'
 > 
 > router is not the right L3 configuration for OpenDaylight, this is
 > for just regular OVS setup based on agents. The correct
 > service_plugin should be odl_router_v2. Stevedore aliases are
 > supported in networking-bgpvpn, so that's why we change from:
 > 
 > networking_bgpvpn.neutron.services.plugin.BGPVPNPlugin
 > 
 > to:
 > 
 > bgpvpn
 > 
 > And finally, we also add trunk, because it's also included in all
 > the OpenDaylight environment files:
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/pike/environments/neutron-opendaylight.yaml
 > https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/pike/environments/neutron-opendaylight-dpdk.yaml

Yes, but that doesn't explain *why* you didn't do the same thing on the master patch. Have a look at the master patch again:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/500573/

Why didn't you use the bgpvpn alias there?

We shouldn't be changing patches when we backport them unless the reason is clearly captured. If you need to do another master patch to switch to use the alias, and then backport that separately, that would be fine."}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2017-10-02 08:47:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > > i don't understand the reason for the difference in this patch
 > > from
 > > > the master version, and the bug does not explain it either.
 > > >
 > > > why delete the additional plugins in pike?
 > >
 > > Hi James,
 > > This environment file configures networking-bgpvpn with
 > > OpenDaylight as service_provider. Let me explain the old version:
 > > NeutronServicePlugins: 'router, networking_bgpvpn.neutron.services.plugin.BGPVPNPlugin'
 > >
 > > router is not the right L3 configuration for OpenDaylight, this
 > is
 > > for just regular OVS setup based on agents. The correct
 > > service_plugin should be odl_router_v2. Stevedore aliases are
 > > supported in networking-bgpvpn, so that's why we change from:
 > >
 > > networking_bgpvpn.neutron.services.plugin.BGPVPNPlugin
 > >
 > > to:
 > >
 > > bgpvpn
 > >
 > > And finally, we also add trunk, because it's also included in all
 > > the OpenDaylight environment files:
 > >
 > > https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/pike/environments/neutron-opendaylight.yaml
 > > https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/pike/environments/neutron-opendaylight-dpdk.yaml
 > 
 > Yes, but that doesn't explain *why* you didn't do the same thing on
 > the master patch. Have a look at the master patch again:
 > 
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/500573/
 > 
 > Why didn't you use the bgpvpn alias there?
 > 
 > We shouldn't be changing patches when we backport them unless the
 > reason is clearly captured. If you need to do another master patch
 > to switch to use the alias, and then backport that separately, that
 > would be fine.

Alright! I see what you mean now. You are totally right.
How should I proceed? Abandon this patch, fix master and backport?"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-10-04 22:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

yes please fix master and then backport both patches to pike'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2017-10-11 15:45:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-01-19 12:08:35.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

master is fixed and contains the same code as this patch intends to.'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-01-19 12:09:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-01-19 12:21:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I restored this patch because it fixes in Pike the service plugins of the BGPVPN OpenDaylight environment file. However, it comprises two different patches:

- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/500573/ (which fixes the plugins)
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/511277/7/environments/neutron-bgpvpn-opendaylight.yaml (which uses stevedore alias)'}, {'account_id': 17280, 'date': '2018-01-19 22:15:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I think we need to backport each change separately.  Can you just change this patch to only backport the first one?'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-01-22 12:42:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Not a clean cherrypick, agreed with Tim.'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-01-22 12:54:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Guys, how do you want me to cherry pick this patch:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/511277

when all the files related to the L2GW plugin will fail (because there is not stevedore alias support in Pike for it)???

If the second cherry pick is not a clean one, what's the point of needing two of them?"}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-01-24 10:01:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-01-25 10:40:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Document flat limit enforcement model

This commit describes enforcement models and documents the only
enforcement model currently supported, which is flat enforcement.

bp unified-limits

Change-Id: I37aa7b57ce5e52e995a7ebc0db94dd0caccea461

[{'created': '2018-01-26 17:55:46.000000000', 'message': 'Add documentation describing unified limits

This commit add some high-level documentation from the unified limit
specification to the administrator guide. A subsequent patch will

Add documentation describing unified limits

This commit add some high-level documentation from the unified limit
specification to the administrator guide. A subsequent patch will
elaborate on enforcement models.

bp unified-limits

(7 comments)

I found couple of new places.
Cheers,
gibi'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-02-01 14:34:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@gibi - I didn't include those for one of two reasons:
a) They *are* valid UUIDs, albeit hard-coded (e.g., "33333333-aaaa-bbbb-cccc-444444444444")
b) They are not used in a UUIDField in oslo.versionedobjects, and thus were not part of the bug.

If you prefer, I will go ahead and fix these in a follow-up patch, but it would have to wait until Rocky, since they aren't technically "bugs".'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-02-01 14:41:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

> @gibi - I didn't include those for one of two reasons:
 > a) They *are* valid UUIDs, albeit hard-coded (e.g.,
 > "33333333-aaaa-bbbb-cccc-444444444444")
 > b) They are not used in a UUIDField in oslo.versionedobjects, and
 > thus were not part of the bug.
 > 
 > If you prefer, I will go ahead and fix these in a follow-up patch,
 > but it would have to wait until Rocky, since they aren't
 > technically "bugs".

OK, let's fix those in a follow up. 
Cheers,
gibi'}]

where the object was expecting a UUID, which caused lots of warning

proper UUIDs.

Closes-Bug: #1606647

commit_message:
Fix invalid UUIDs in remaining tests

There were many places throughout our tests that used plain strings
where the object was expecting a UUID, which caused lots of warning
output when running the tests. This patch replaces all such usages with
proper UUIDs.

Closes-Bug: #1606647

Change-Id: Ib339b97ef178c870405e19385d3df24dd1f730cc

Activate ipsec for for featureset042

This aims to test the IPSec feature. Note that this feature
strictly depends on the config-download flag and network
isolation.

So, there are docs.

But, if we remote the option here we need something in docs in ironic tree referencing the docs in networking-baremetal? And upgrade section in release-notes.

(1 comment)

> Yeah... I've had several patches to ironic/devstack/lib/ironic to
 > try to fix that, e.g. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/392959/ but
 > due to a giant mess of merge conflicts I never got it completed. I
 > had it working though, and neutron was using flat networks as it
 > should be.

Thanks for pointing out that work Sam. I would like to work on it to see if I can rebase it and get it to a working state. If you don't mind? (I have rebased it locally and running a first test locally.)

I guess we have 3 options for this:

a) We first get the CI updated to use flat networks, probably by continuing Sam's earlier work.
b) We land it, and update the CI after. (Considering the CI is green, despite the errors in neutron logs ...)
c) We re-introduce the option, either default to bind using host_id or default to the new behaviour and in the latter case disable it in CI for now.

To state the obvious, personally I would like to land this so my vote is for b) or c)."}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-01-26 12:08:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-20 16:27:20.000000000', 'message': 'Add routed networks support to flat interfaces

When new option enable_routed_flat_network in
neutron group is True the flat driver will use
the ironic node uuid as binding:host_id when
ports are bound.

Also set the binding:vnic_type to baremetal so
that the mechanism driver in networking-baremetal
can bind the port.

Related-Bug: 1658964
Depends-On: I952c7afbef5e80e3fd2a7f32f11bdc522e1ea397
Change-Id: I7841d59c3590106dd8ac7e625a9db7b47674fe29
'}, {'created': '2018-01-21 02:19:01.000000000', 'message': 'Add routed networks support to flat interfaces

can bind the port.

commit_message:
Flat networks use node.uuid when binding ports.

The flat driver will use the ironic node uuid as
binding:host_id when ports are bound. Also the
binding:vnic_type will be baremetal so that the mechanism
driver in networking-baremetal can bind the port.

Related-Bug: 1658964
Depends-On: I952c7afbef5e80e3fd2a7f32f11bdc522e1ea397
Change-Id: I7841d59c3590106dd8ac7e625a9db7b47674fe29

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-31 20:51:23.000000000', 'message': '[api-ref] clarify what /v1/lookup returns

Update the api-ref documentation for the /v1/lookup API, so that
it mentions the node fields that are returned. It does not return
the configdrive value (that is bleeped out in the response).

Change-Id: I24a47a2cfefc582bd0b5f1f0068e89a3091cf397
'}]
commit_message:
[api-ref] clarify what /v1/lookup returns

Update the api-ref documentation for the /v1/lookup API, so that
it mentions the node fields that are returned. It does not return
the configdrive value (that is bleeped out in the response).

Change-Id: I24a47a2cfefc582bd0b5f1f0068e89a3091cf397

commit_message:
node_tag_exists(): raise exception if bad node

To make tags consistent with traits, change db.api.node_tag_exists()
to raise a NodeNotFound exception if the node doesn't exist.

This is a follow up to bbff319f0226af11af3c2864ad8f678abef6dcdb.

Change-Id: Id0ddf448d97b5ac22ef5dc27154a1b229514a968
Partial-Bug:#1526266

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Id2fb18a57c1f5d562a2e81109295b3979c0d738c

commit_message:
conf: Validate '[api] vendordata_providers' options

Only two options are currently supported. Let's hardcode this behavior.

Change-Id: I7609f408294ca151db9b7ff43d8c7bf6a4638a94

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-05-26 09:18:43.000000000', 'message': 'Add linked clone option in glance metadata

Change-Id: I27cd33b9b9593de61a6558879d337685ebd6f734
'}, {'created': '2017-06-05 02:33:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add linked clone option in glance metadata

The glance must upload the VMDK file from Glance to ESXi datastore when the
image does not exist in VMware environment. To optimize this process, the VMDK
file is cached on a datastore when the file is used for the first time.
However, if we create VMs on another datastore, the cached VMDK file must be
copied from the cache location to the target datastore. In order to avoid
this, we add linked clone option in glance metedata. If set this option to
true, we can avoid this copy operation.

Change-Id: I27cd33b9b9593de61a6558879d337685ebd6f734
'}, {'created': '2017-06-13 02:16:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add linked clone option in glance metadata

However, if we create VMs on another datastore, the cached VMDK file must be
copied from the cache location to the target datastore. In order to avoid
this, we add linked clone option in glance metedata. If set this option to
true, we can avoid this copy operation.

Change-Id: I27cd33b9b9593de61a6558879d337685ebd6f734
'}, {'created': '2017-11-20 06:27:07.000000000', 'message': 'Add linked clone option in glance metadata

However, if we create VMs on another datastore, the cached VMDK file must be
copied from the cache location to the target datastore. In order to avoid
this, we add linked clone option in glance metedata. If set this option to
true, we can avoid this copy operation.

Change-Id: I27cd33b9b9593de61a6558879d337685ebd6f734
'}, {'created': '2017-11-30 07:22:04.000000000', 'message': "Add img_linked_clone to compute vmware metadefs

The nova vmware driver checks images for the 'img_linked_clone' property at
boot time, but that property is missing in OS::Compute::VMware metadefs.
This patch adds 'img_linked_clone' property. No default value is specified for
this property as the default behavior in a particular cloud depends on the
nova configuration setting for 'vmware.use_linked_clone'.

DocImpact: add to metadefs release note

Change-Id: I27cd33b9b9593de61a6558879d337685ebd6f734
"}]
commit_message:
Add img_linked_clone to compute vmware metadefs

The nova vmware driver checks images for the 'img_linked_clone' property at
boot time, but that property is missing in OS::Compute::VMware metadefs.
This patch adds 'img_linked_clone' property. No default value is specified for
this property as the default behavior in a particular cloud depends on the
nova configuration setting for 'vmware.use_linked_clone'.

DocImpact: add to metadefs release note

Change-Id: I27cd33b9b9593de61a6558879d337685ebd6f734

commit_message:
use . instead of source.

Code conventions: Use â.â to source script files
When you have to source a script file, for example ,
a credentials file to gain access to user-only or
 admin-only CLI commands, use . instead of source.
See more:
http://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/writing-style/code-conventions

Change-Id: I1788a2e5f1d9e067e2411bb159316ca7990fe46f

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-31 03:44:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix segmentation-id to integer in test

The validate_subports test passes string as segmentation-id but
it must be integer. It means that the validator can pass wrong value
to neutron but there is no issue in neutron side because trunk
service plugin converts the value to integer[1]. The convert should
be done in service plugin side so this patch fix a test only.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/services/trunk/rules.py#L248-L249

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I9ead1808c8622a30f0831486ceaedf3097dd2065
'}]
commit_message:
Fix segmentation-id to integer in test

The validate_subports test passes string as segmentation-id but
it must be integer. It means that the validator can pass wrong value
to neutron but there is no issue in neutron side because trunk
service plugin converts the value to integer[1]. The convert should
be done in service plugin side so this patch fix a test only.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/services/trunk/rules.py#L248-L249

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I9ead1808c8622a30f0831486ceaedf3097dd2065

Closes-Bug: #1746308

commit_message:
Endpoint_type of private is not valid

There are three valid endpoint_type values. They are public, internal,
admin. Currently internal is configured as 'private' which is not valid.
This replaces 'private' with 'internal'.

Change-Id: I45a8afcc6eb09cb9970c0e01a99bf64bb8723e05
Closes-Bug: #1746308

Thanks! I hate asserts in production code.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-01-30 07:24:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ruby,

I am not against asserts in principle (even in 'production' code), they are a valuable tool especially when your code is meant to be consumed by others as a library or framework. And we have quite a number of those in the code (just grep assert) - but mostly they are  sort of 'plain' asserts, right in the beginning of a function/method.

What is wrong is when execution of some other piece of logic is conditionally dependent on the result of the assert (mostly see it in a try-assert-except AssertionError  constructs)."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-01-31 12:34:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-01-31 14:44:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

raising a proper exception instance now'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-02-01 14:33:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

and yes, we have a unit test for that:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-29 17:56:02.000000000', 'message': "Do not use asserts with business logic

a piece of code in node object was relying on result of 'assert'
to block negative values of properties.

When running Python in optimized mode (-OO) this assert will be
swallowed and negative values may slip through.

Replace this line with proper if-block.

Change-Id: Iec1edc55219cfd6c54afa52c1ecd0cf76340bddf
"}, {'created': '2018-02-01 13:59:37.000000000', 'message': "Do not use asserts with business logic

a piece of code in node object was relying on result of 'assert'
to block negative values of properties.

When running Python in optimized mode (-OO) this assert will be
swallowed and negative values may slip through.

Replace this line with proper if-block.

Change-Id: Iec1edc55219cfd6c54afa52c1ecd0cf76340bddf
"}]
commit_message:
Do not use asserts with business logic

a piece of code in node object was relying on result of 'assert'
to block negative values of properties.

When running Python in optimized mode (-OO) this assert will be
swallowed and negative values may slip through.

Replace this line with proper if-block.

Change-Id: Iec1edc55219cfd6c54afa52c1ecd0cf76340bddf

commit_message:
Use xenial for vagrant image

When using Vagrant to create a development environment, use Ubuntu
Xenial (16.04) instead of Trusty (14.04)

Update the Vagrantfile and vagrant.yml to handle this change.

 * Install Python if not installed, as Ansible requires it
 * Change username from 'vagrant' to 'ubuntu'

Change-Id: I0dedac6ce388de29b98290f85d750a41807de07e

messages:
[{'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2018-01-02 07:28:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23081, 'date': '2018-01-10 01:57:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Yes, when turn on the CONF.volume_feature_enabled.api_v3, the tempest should test all v3 APIs (including v3.0 (==v2 APIs) and all v3.x (x==microversion) APIs.'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-01-10 06:36:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

This makes sense. The document[0] says, 

 The 3.0 Cinder API includes all v2 core APIs existing prior to the introduction of microversions.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/contributor/api_microversion_history.html#maximum-in-mitaka'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2018-01-25 22:17:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

LGTM, want to wait for more reviews to notify this change in the team.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-02-01 11:19:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

looks good as of now. as final set i am working on making all tests version less and run all gate job with v3 and test the same set of tests with v2 in separate job.

But that will take so i am ok with this approach.

commit_message:
Support only volume api_v3 is enabled

Now if we set CONF.volume_feature_enabled.api_v2 to False while
setting CONF.volume_feature_enabled.api_v3 to True, some testcases
can't work properly, e.g., in scenario.manager.py, we have
    "if not client:
        client = self.os_admin.volume_types_v2_client"

In fact, we should support only volume api_v3 is enabled, which means
to run all volume testcases using v3 interfaces(not only those new
functions added in v3).

So this is to transfer all volume v2 clients to using v3 interfaces
if only api_v3 is enabled.

Change-Id: I6924f295bcc84797e3c59f8cc4b68c1e251b931d

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ifc8d8bbe6950aeca9fa017fcfcc2eb60027f5081

commit_message:
Do not skip entire testcase if floating_ip is not enabled

TestMinimumBasicScenario and TestServerBasicOps are useful
and basic scenario testcases, in which floating_ip is not an
essential part and just a connecting method, so it's not
reasonable to skip entire testcase if floating_ip is not enabled.
This is to skip the creating of floating_ip when floating_ip
is not enabled, and use fixed_ip to ssh the server instead,
so we can still keep the most part of the test steps.

Change-Id: I3e99304462950c194a4d73237cfc594631ca3868

commit_message:
Add 'delete_host' command in 'nova-manage cell_v2'

Add 'delete_host' command in 'nova-manage cell_v2'.
Add an optional 'force' option in 'nova-manage cell_v2 delete_cell'.
If specifying the 'force' option, a cell can be deleted
even if the cell has hosts.

The 'features' description is changed to the 'fixes'
in the release note.

Conflicts:
        doc/source/cli/nova-manage.rst

Change-Id: I8cd7826c2c03687c6b85731519778f09d542b236
Closes-Bug: #1721179
(cherry-picked from commit f4f17b364e28389f22bf9c6017dd7aef918c7104)

commit_message:
Always save the logs from tag-releases

Sometimes when the job succeeds we still need to review the logs to
see why some expected action wasn't taken.

Change-Id: I82000bd3a29415201633931dd4ed5969da7b0377
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Enable more extensions in pep8

This patch enable extensions:
-[H204] Use assert(Not)Equal to check for equality.
-[H205] Use assert(Greater|Less)(Equal) for comparison.

Change-Id: I04b06851e13dd34c63040b648dff576f68a7abec

[{'created': '2017-11-13 20:07:26.000000000', 'message': "Log options at debug when starting API services under wsgi

The ServiceLauncher and ProcessLauncher in oslo.service will,
by default, log config options at DEBUG level at the start
of a service, which is what would happen when starting nova-api
using eventlet.

Running nova-api under wsgi has been supported since Pike, but
the wsgi app code doesn't log the debug options like oslo.service
would, so this adds that back in.

The placement-api wsgi app code would log the options but based on
whether or not debug logging is enabled, which is different from how
it works in oslo.service, so the config option that is checked is
changed in this patch, and a release note is added for that subtle
behavior change.

Closes-Bug: #1732000

Change-Id: I680fd9761a049cac619b7793fa5c60e6daf4fa47

commit_message:
Log options at debug when starting API services under wsgi

The ServiceLauncher and ProcessLauncher in oslo.service will,
by default, log config options at DEBUG level at the start
of a service, which is what would happen when starting nova-api
using eventlet.

Running nova-api under wsgi has been supported since Pike, but
the wsgi app code doesn't log the debug options like oslo.service
would, so this adds that back in.

The placement-api wsgi app code would log the options but based on
whether or not debug logging is enabled, which is different from how
it works in oslo.service, so the config option that is checked is
changed in this patch, and a release note is added for that subtle
behavior change.

Closes-Bug: #1732000

Change-Id: I680fd9761a049cac619b7793fa5c60e6daf4fa47

commit_message:
3PAR: Fixed sync period updation in rcg

During group update, sync period value was not
updated in remote copy group.

This patch will fix and update the sync period
value in remote copy group for periodic mode.

Change-Id: I4a2384f9f01020f1361b5bc8cc03f09ef68b008c
Closes-Bug: #1746235

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ia190b510f06d1140f95589543596d9949cfc4f88

commit_message:
Deduplicate service status notification samples

This patch refactors the sample files of service-create, service-delete
and service-update notifications to use a common ServiceStatusPayload
sample data.

This patch addresses the problem which lead the revert of the commit
I708ce5423806d2913e77abbe338aec970a5009dc.

Change-Id: I2f619089ae88d05207bb3432c63546a298f0bf15

commit_message:
Deduplicate aggregate notification samples

This patch refactors the sample files of aggregate-add_host,
aggregate-delete, aggregate-create and aggregate-remove_host
notifications to use a common AggregatePayload sample data.

Change-Id: I50382f4d829693412bbfe47ffd08a24e69342715

commit_message:
Mention required traits in the flavors user docs

This takes most of the release note and adds it to the user
flavor docs which is more discoverable for an end user.

Change-Id: Ia83af4dfcc0c040679b0d0cd5282830fca27bd63

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-24 10:22:40.000000000', 'message': "Make tempest-full-py3 voting

The job is ready to replace the legacy one in the integration
gate py3 template. Before that can happen make it voting and add
some extra documentation to it.

The parent does not need to be tempest-full since that does not
add much useful as opposed to devstack-tempest and it's actually
better for the two jobs to be independent.

Change-Id: I4a8fa1759665038788e1b86fd3a5030fd6c68573
"}]
commit_message:
Make tempest-full-py3 voting

The job is ready to replace the legacy one in the integration
gate py3 template. Before that can happen make it voting and add
some extra documentation to it.

The parent does not need to be tempest-full since that does not
add much useful as opposed to devstack-tempest and it's actually
better for the two jobs to be independent.

Change-Id: I4a8fa1759665038788e1b86fd3a5030fd6c68573

commit_message:
set_{aggregates|traits}_for_provider: tolerate set

Report client's set_aggregates_for_provider and set_traits_for_provider
methods declare in their docstring that they accept an iterable for the
aggregates/traits parameter.  However, passing in a set results in a
JSON serialization error.  We could solve this by changing the docstring
(accept only lists).  Or, as is done here, by tolerating other kinds of
iterables, converting them to lists.

Change-Id: I749ffbd9a55ee71d5dbd266ef6faa4be4a1d395b
blueprint: nested-resource-providers

subject: ProviderTree.get_provider_uuids: Top-down ordering

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 23:38:03.000000000', 'message': 'ProviderTree.get_provider_uuids: Top-down ordering

It will become important in update_from_provider_tree to be able to walk
the providers in a ProviderTree in a sane and predictable order.
Otherwise, when flushing multiple adds/deletes, we will have no reliable
way to avoid creating orphans (which will fail).

Here we change ProviderTree.get_provider_uuids from returning a set() to
returning a list which is guaranteed to be in top-down order.  We do not
guarantee the order in which siblings appear, or where nephews appear
relative to their uncles; just that a child will always appear after its
parent (and, by extension, after all its ancestors).

Change-Id: I2fb691e019177c502ec651390faf3740a2d49045
blueprint: nested-resource-providers
