It will become important in update_from_provider_tree to be able to walk
the providers in a ProviderTree in a sane and predictable order.
Otherwise, when flushing multiple adds/deletes, we will have no reliable
way to avoid creating orphans (which will fail).

Here we change ProviderTree.get_provider_uuids from returning a set() to
returning a list which is guaranteed to be in top-down order.  We do not
guarantee the order in which siblings appear, or where nephews appear
relative to their uncles; just that a child will always appear after its
parent (and, by extension, after all its ancestors).

Change-Id: I2fb691e019177c502ec651390faf3740a2d49045
blueprint: nested-resource-providers
'}]
commit_message:
ProviderTree.get_provider_uuids: Top-down ordering

It will become important in update_from_provider_tree to be able to walk
the providers in a ProviderTree in a sane and predictable order.
Otherwise, when flushing multiple adds/deletes, we will have no reliable
way to avoid creating orphans (which will fail).

Here we change ProviderTree.get_provider_uuids from returning a set() to
returning a list which is guaranteed to be in top-down order.  We do not
guarantee the order in which siblings appear, or where nephews appear
relative to their uncles; just that a child will always appear after its
parent (and, by extension, after all its ancestors).

Change-Id: I2fb691e019177c502ec651390faf3740a2d49045
blueprint: nested-resource-providers

commit_message:
Set restrictive file permissions on Ceph keyrings for non-containerized deployment

Pass mode parameter 0640 and user and group ownership to puppet-ceph for
Ceph openstack client keyrings during non-containerized deployment.

Author:    Keith Schincke <kschinck@redhat.com>
Co-Author:    John Fulton <fulton@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iccb24f5c2ee639ad2bc0869a37cec305f32b9fd1
Depends-On: I6f1b8f9fb410ac655c96cc9aab7f06e203cdc31b
Partial-Bug: #1720787
(cherry picked from commit bdf1ade1b9de994c3098fb17cca6dd64b3d14cd5)

commit_message:
SchedulerReportClient._delete_provider

SchedulerReportClient._delete_provider is a new private helper method to
delete a resource provider, appropriately logging errors and raising
appropriate exceptions.

The existing public delete_resource_provider method is refactored to use
the new helper in a backward-compatible way.  In a future patch, we
should a) rename this method to delete_compute_provider or similar, and
b) make it actually raise exceptions on error (today it just logs and
carries on).

Change-Id: I05c838faca626d2ef238157a8d8cdee5df16aa01

Ideally, the boot interface shouldn't care if it's booting an image for
deploy or rescue. The first step to unwinding this is not passing the
mode argument into the boot interface - for now, we infer it from the
state. Also stop validating whether the boot interface methods have a
mode argument, as this is totally broken anyway (due to the decorator on
the method). The rest of the boot interface's knowledge about deploy vs
rescue can be eliminated in the future, as we shouldn't rework too much
of that during feature freeze.

We fix the bug in validation this way for now, for two reasons:

* This argument really doesn't belong, and it's only been on master for
  six days. Get it out before people use it.
* Library updates are currently frozen; fixing the decorator isn't an
  option right now.

commit_message:
Remove mode argument from boot.(prepare|clean_up)_ramdisk

Ideally, the boot interface shouldn't care if it's booting an image for
deploy or rescue. The first step to unwinding this is not passing the
mode argument into the boot interface - for now, we infer it from the
state. Also stop validating whether the boot interface methods have a
mode argument, as this is totally broken anyway (due to the decorator on
the method). The rest of the boot interface's knowledge about deploy vs
rescue can be eliminated in the future, as we shouldn't rework too much
of that during feature freeze.

We fix the bug in validation this way for now, for two reasons:

* This argument really doesn't belong, and it's only been on master for
  six days. Get it out before people use it.
* Library updates are currently frozen; fixing the decorator isn't an
  option right now.

Change-Id: Icdeb870e9fd9cf836ff7ab97624189c8436adaba
Closes-Bug: #1746730

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks

    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be

    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more

    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code

commit_message:
Rewrite iptables rules with Ansible module

The iptables module in Ansible checks if the rule already exists and is
therefore idempotent. The original iptables rule is not, so the rules
get longer and longer.

Change-Id: Id3162bd9b53a2fcda57aace484706c1cc4217578
Signed-off-by: Tapio Tallgren <tapio.tallgren@nokia.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-29 17:13:15.000000000', 'message': 'Gate db{-admin} relations until cluster is ready

Percona-cluster was responding to db and db-admin relations before it
was ready. This led to the error: "WSREP has not yet prepared node for
application use."

This change applies the same gating share-db relation already has to db
and db-admin relations. It also condenses code used in both instances.

The change also attempts to address Bug 1738896.

Closes-Bug: #1742683
Closes-Bug: #1738896
Change-Id: If525595fd109e6a738071a3f016b9c2eabec529e
'}, {'created': '2018-01-31 02:37:47.000000000', 'message': 'Gate db{-admin} relations until cluster is ready

Percona-cluster was responding to db and db-admin relations before it
was ready. This led to the error: "WSREP has not yet prepared node for
application use."

This change applies the same gating share-db relation already has to db
and db-admin relations. It also condenses code used in both instances.

This change guarantees the rendered configuration will not
auto-bootstrap for non-leaders. This addresses Bug 1738896.

Closes-Bug: #1742683

commit_message:
Gate db{-admin} relations until cluster is ready

Percona-cluster was responding to db and db-admin relations before it
was ready. This led to the error: "WSREP has not yet prepared node for
application use."

This change applies the same gating share-db relation already has to db
and db-admin relations. It also condenses code used in both instances.

This change guarantees the rendered configuration will not
auto-bootstrap for non-leaders. This addresses Bug 1738896.

Closes-Bug: #1742683
Closes-Bug: #1738896
Change-Id: If525595fd109e6a738071a3f016b9c2eabec529e

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I8ca14f20699ef66f79263f43c0224a0e7e7371b1

commit_message:
Devstack - use neutron segments (routed provider networks)

When IRONIC_USE_NEUTRON_SEGMENTS is True:
* The provisioning subnet is associated with the segment on the
  provisioning network.
* The baremetal node ports is created with --physical-network set.

The neutron segments service_plugin must be enabled to allow
associating the subnet with the segment.

Change-Id: Ie6dcebf24413c65ecdc3e0c56cc56f8d88dc406c

commit_message:
Switch the CI to hardware types

The granade job is left intact, as it requires IRONIC_ENABLED_INSPECT_INTERFACES
devstack configuration, which was introduced in Queens.

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I13a0cc5b03fc347470f027ad4b639ecd4e297cae

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-01 10:14:15.000000000', 'message': "Use the tests ansible-previous venv

When doing the role upgrade, we run every playbook with current's
branch ansible. This is normal for the infrastructure bits (which
are running on current branch), but not for the installation of
the previous branch's role, which should use previous branch's
environment.

The tests repo now has this venv, so we should make use of it.

Depends-On: I7ebb045885dd645b820de2b7f75b46c755c015f6
Change-Id: I579a3f7b641e02f40ed1b21f523aecbb9f16835a
Related-Bug: #1741471
"}]
commit_message:
Use the tests ansible-previous venv

When doing the role upgrade, we run every playbook with current's
branch ansible. This is normal for the infrastructure bits (which
are running on current branch), but not for the installation of
the previous branch's role, which should use previous branch's
environment.

The tests repo now has this venv, so we should make use of it.

Depends-On: I7ebb045885dd645b820de2b7f75b46c755c015f6
Change-Id: I579a3f7b641e02f40ed1b21f523aecbb9f16835a
Related-Bug: #1741471

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I39690fa9b77d8361f136f5e36109cc07628df741

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-27 18:42:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-01-27 23:18:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck

maybe legit?'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-28 01:04:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck grenade floating ip remove fail'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-28 01:05:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This is what's failing in the grenade job but there is no indication of what the actual failure is:

http://logs.openstack.org/70/538070/2/check/neutron-grenade-multinode/1047508/logs/grenade.sh.txt.gz#_2018-01-28_00_07_16_094"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-28 01:06:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I bet I know what's going on - OSC is probably using the novaclient API bindings to call removeFloatingIP, which is gone in 10.0.0:

https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/python-novaclient/queens.html#id4

So we'd have to fix OSC first, which means this isn't going to happen in Queens."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-28 01:09:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yup right here:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/python-openstackclient/tree/openstackclient/compute/v2/floatingip.py#n97

Alternatively, we fix grenade so it's not using openstack server remove floating ip and just calls the networking CLI."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-28 02:13:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Opened bug 1745795 for the grenade issue.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-28 02:20:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-01-28 04:14:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

good to see this passing :D'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-01-28 13:58:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Depends on patches still nerd treatment'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-01-28 18:26:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-30 19:57:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

For the record, I'm fine with holding this out for Rocky:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-January/126741.html

Nothing requires novaclient>=10.0.0 in Queens."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-01-30 20:29:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1 Code-Review-2

not needed for pike, proceedural -2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-01 19:15:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Added to group update for delayed lib releases.'}]

Looks good, one comment just a style thing.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-12-14 14:42:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2799, 'date': '2017-12-18 02:02:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Ahh of course, that makes sense - question then, how do we ensure that gets run? e.g. if i set the group_var, the playbooks aren't going to care.

That seems to be a problem right? E.g. if we set it in group_vars it's going to not work properly for some of the cases. Maybe we could do the default ('lxc') then not set it in group_vars and document that it has to been in the user_vars. if you want to override it? Just trying to figure out a way that we can avoid tripping up deployers where they want non-lxc container tech but it still does some lxc bits. Perhaps im missing the point though!"}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-12-18 02:58:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Ahh of course, that makes sense - question then, how do we ensure
 > that gets run? e.g. if i set the group_var, the playbooks aren't
 > going to care.
 > 
 > That seems to be a problem right? E.g. if we set it in group_vars
 > it's going to not work properly for some of the cases. Maybe we
 > could do the default ('lxc') then not set it in group_vars and
 > document that it has to been in the user_vars. if you want to
 > override it? Just trying to figure out a way that we can avoid
 > tripping up deployers where they want non-lxc container tech but it
 > still does some lxc bits. Perhaps im missing the point though!

This makes a lot of sense. I'll adjust the docs and set the default everywhere."}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-12-18 03:09:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-01-02 14:21:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-01-03 13:36:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

I'd like to finish the bare metal provisioning first, before merging a conflicting patch."}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-01-03 15:48:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> I'd like to finish the bare metal provisioning first, before
 > merging a conflicting patch.


This shouldn't have any hold on that PR impact on that PR so there should be issues with the two going in at the same time. Additionally that PR is not passing the gates at the moment while this one is so it seems silly to block when this work was apart of the greater nspawn effort originally and was only broken out at your request. Given that the "all metal" patch will need a few more commits to make right we might as well rebase it on this commit to remove the conflicts (if that's the concern).'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-01-03 17:21:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: -Code-Review

While I'd still prefer the bare metal patch to go first [1], I'd be enclined to say "first come, first served".

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/504224

I haven't reviewed in details yet, so I can't give a positive vote.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-01-04 15:11:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I think the aio_lxc shouldn't exist, and it will become more and more confusing in the future.

What about using another axis for that, whose var would be container_tech: lxc by default, and that we can override in jobs? It would make the upgrade story simple, and the new jobs would be clearly an override in the job definition, which is closer to "native" ansible for zuul v3. On top of that, moving from lxc to nspawn would be just a job definition variable change + maybe a change in bootstrap-host/defaults/main.yml if we have a fallback there.

I'd rather leave the other speak, to see if they see a value for that, or if we keep continuing with new scenarii.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-01-04 21:28:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Published edit on patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-01-04 21:29:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-01-04 21:33:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-01-04 21:35:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> (3 comments)
 > 
 > I think the aio_lxc shouldn't exist, and it will become more and
 > more confusing in the future.
 > 
 > What about using another axis for that, whose var would be
 > container_tech: lxc by default, and that we can override in jobs?
 > It would make the upgrade story simple, and the new jobs would be
 > clearly an override in the job definition, which is closer to
 > "native" ansible for zuul v3. On top of that, moving from lxc to
 > nspawn would be just a job definition variable change + maybe a
 > change in bootstrap-host/defaults/main.yml if we have a fallback
 > there.
 > 
 > I'd rather leave the other speak, to see if they see a value for
 > that, or if we keep continuing with new scenarii.

I'm open to changing the job scenario layout however I'm not sure that belongs in this patch. While this does change the aio name to "aio_lxc" this is using the existing pattern.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-01-05 16:46:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> > (3 comments)
 > >
 > > I think the aio_lxc shouldn't exist, and it will become more and
 > > more confusing in the future.
 > >
 > > What about using another axis for that, whose var would be
 > > container_tech: lxc by default, and that we can override in jobs?
 > > It would make the upgrade story simple, and the new jobs would be
 > > clearly an override in the job definition, which is closer to
 > > "native" ansible for zuul v3. On top of that, moving from lxc to
 > > nspawn would be just a job definition variable change + maybe a
 > > change in bootstrap-host/defaults/main.yml if we have a fallback
 > > there.
 > >
 > > I'd rather leave the other speak, to see if they see a value for
 > > that, or if we keep continuing with new scenarii.
 > 
 > I'm open to changing the job scenario layout however I'm not sure
 > that belongs in this patch. While this does change the aio name to
 > "aio_lxc" this is using the existing pattern.

That's why I'd say let's stick with what we have to not add more moving parts, and in a later patch, move to use aio_lxc or introduce a new axis.'}, {'account_id': 15993, 'date': '2018-01-05 16:58:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-01-08 15:11:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

(4 comments)

I'm okay with the aio_lxc scenario name for now, and I don't have objections for the rest of the patch. I did find a few nits in the commit message, though."}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-01-09 21:02:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-01-09 21:02:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-01-10 10:52:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review-2

Administrative vote:
We currently have so many bugs for the upgrades (due to ansible 2.4/hyper converged/many others), I'd rather leave this as is before merging. Maybe we can work on the full chain of things and merge the whole nspawn story in one week (if we have a chain of commits ready?)"}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-01-12 22:39:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> Administrative vote:
 > We currently have so many bugs for the upgrades (due to ansible
 > 2.4/hyper converged/many others), I'd rather leave this as is
 > before merging. Maybe we can work on the full chain of things and
 > merge the whole nspawn story in one week (if we have a chain of
 > commits ready?)

I fail to see how this impacts any of the mentioned issues or why this is being blocked. This is a small change that's easy to review and has no functional impact on our system. If there's an issue with this change-set I'd be happy to address that in subsequent PRs but an administrative block for unrelated features on ONLY this PR seems out of place."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-01-22 17:07:42.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-2 by Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-13 17:33:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add scafolding for multiple container techs

This change makes it possible for us to add future support for multiple
container technolofies within a single deployment. A new variable has
been added allowing the deployer to set the container tech within a
dpleoyment. At this point the only supported container tech is "lxc"
however in a follow on PR we intend to add systemd-nspawn.

Change-Id: I8c2f8f29a93a3212de73c74c7d1ab7d851bbd204
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2017-12-13 17:40:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add scafolding for multiple container techs

however in a follow on PR we intend to add systemd-nspawn.

Change-Id: I8c2f8f29a93a3212de73c74c7d1ab7d851bbd204

commit_message:
Add scaffolding for multiple container techs

This change makes it possible for us to add future support for multiple
container technologies within a single deployment. A new variable has
been added allowing the deployer to set the container tech within a
deployment. At this point the only supported container tech is "lxc"
however in a follow on PR we intend to add systemd-nspawn.

The playbooks for lxc-containers-* have all been renamed so we have a
consistent experience when sourcing and executing container type plays.
To ensure this change does not break existing deployer automation links
have been created for the old playbook names. In a future release we can
remove these links.

Change-Id: I8c2f8f29a93a3212de73c74c7d1ab7d851bbd204
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-08 07:15:41.000000000', 'message': '3PAR: Update CHAP on host record when volume is migrated to new compute host

When the nova instances are migrated from one compute host to another,
during the new VLUN creation step, the host record created on 3PAR has
the old chap credentials, but the volume metadata contains the newly
generated CHAP credentials. This fix will ensure the CHAP authentication
credentials on volume metadata and the host record on 3PAR are in sync
when the nova instances are live migrated.

Closes-Bug: #1737181

Change-Id: I2d4b7530b2d249ca193f7d0e87d529c9eb2dc25d
'}, {'created': '2018-01-08 16:12:32.000000000', 'message': '3PAR: Update CHAP on host record when volume is migrated to new compute host

during the new VLUN creation step, the host record created on 3PAR has
the old chap credentials, but the volume metadata contains the newly
generated CHAP credentials. This fix will ensure the CHAP authentication
credentials on volume metadata and the host record on 3PAR are in sync
when the nova instances are live migrated.

commit_message:
3PAR: Update CHAP on host record when volume is migrated to new compute host

When the nova instances are migrated from one compute host to another,
during the new VLUN creation step, the host record created on 3PAR has
the old chap credentials, but the volume metadata contains the newly
generated CHAP credentials. This fix will ensure the CHAP authentication
credentials on volume metadata and the host record on 3PAR are in sync
when the nova instances are live migrated.

Closes-Bug: #1737181

Change-Id: I2d4b7530b2d249ca193f7d0e87d529c9eb2dc25d
(cherry picked from commit bfc8c849df043d7695c70a5e90e5b95e93ce0728)

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I73558acf0d53efba7a0cf83e60fceb35b86b787f

commit_message:
Update docs links

The links for more_info were pointing to the old location for
bandit's documents, which would redirect to an index.html page.

This change updates the docs to the new location in order to
allow the "more info" link to point to the correct page.

Change-Id: I950ea4601248065dce68a5d21b144703817cf675
Closes-Bug: #1745006

commit_message:
config-download: handle special case for 3nodes job

Until we improve the way HostnameMap is constructed, we need to hack the
file used in CI so we can test config-download on multinode-3nodes job.
This is a temporary fix, and some investigation is in progress to make
this user experience better.

In the meantime, we expect our operators to build HostnameMap themselves
so this patch updates the HostnameMap to work with 3nodes job.

Change-Id: I7d43625ea4b21ceabd07ee6c3e281e8bea195185

[{'created': '2018-01-10 11:18:03.000000000', 'message': "tasks: cinder_qos: Use exact match for QoS rules

The default grep behavior will match any part of the string which
means that rules like 'foo' and 'foo-plus' will be matched if we are
only interested in 'foo'. As such, this is causing problems with QoS
rules which happen to have overlapping names. It's best to use
'grep -x' to only match the rule we are interested in.

Closes-Bug: #1741990
Change-Id: I26f7f4a933e1b96ba7a92efc79f1b87c806ccdc3
"}, {'created': '2018-01-10 12:18:42.000000000', 'message': "tasks: cinder_qos: Use exact match for QoS rules

The default grep behavior will match any part of the string which
means that rules like 'foo' and 'foo-plus' will be matched if we are
only interested in 'foo'. As such, this is causing problems with QoS
rules which happen to have overlapping names. It's best to use
'grep -x' to only match the rule we are interested in.

Closes-Bug: #1741990
Change-Id: I26f7f4a933e1b96ba7a92efc79f1b87c806ccdc3
"}]
commit_message:
tasks: cinder_qos: Use exact match for QoS rules

The default grep behavior will match any part of the string which
means that rules like 'foo' and 'foo-plus' will be matched if we are
only interested in 'foo'. As such, this is causing problems with QoS
rules which happen to have overlapping names. It's best to use
'grep -x' to only match the rule we are interested in.

Closes-Bug: #1741990
Change-Id: I26f7f4a933e1b96ba7a92efc79f1b87c806ccdc3

commit_message:
Restores sushy session functionality.

This patch restores sushy session functionality to the
SessionOrBasicAuth by moving can_refresh_session to its parent
SessionAuth. Also fixed verify being ignored.
Closes-Bug: 1744378

Change-Id: Ia9ce0fe965f13e2d7f7634957306fa4ce6746b39
(cherry picked from commit d03a70f70075879645525a9c30e96ab84d1e45e5)

commit_message:
add a script to find potentially troublesome zuul configuration

This script works best when run with the output "list-deliverables -r"
as arguments. It reports any projects that have potentially bad zuul
configuration.

Change-Id: I06b5bf50291d724ba43d56dcb8c5ba4ca6ff374b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix version details API does not return 200 OK

When use version details api http://ip:8786/v2 to get api details,
it does not return 200 OK, and the return value is empty.

This change is to correct the version details API URL.

Change-Id: I1cde2a35dc84ccaac15d6963f453fd793c54fda4
Closes-Bug: #1742336
